I got it on 13-Oct-2018 with all the accessories mentioned so no issue with the delivery and the item delivered.I am using Nicon Semi DSLR with this tripod. Following are the details :-Height &Weight :-9/10It's very light weight. Only 3 lbs (1.36 Kg). They provided the Zippered carry bag which make it easy to carry for outdoor shooting. It's perfect for most cameras up to 6.6 pounds.Tripodâ€™s legs:-9/10The tripodâ€™s legs can extend from 20â€ to 48â€ which helps to keep the stand stable even the surface isn't flat. Leg locks release smoothly and glide easily to your desired height. Crank up the center post for a tripod that is 60â€ tall which helps to make real videos even there is a huge crowd.The rubber feet adjust to help you achieve the perfect position.At maximum height tripod may loose the stability which will depend on many factors. That's why I gave only 9 out of 10.Level :-9/10There is a built-in level above the legs which lets you know when the base is level. Another one is on the top of the camera plate which lets you know when the camera is level.Also there is a rubber feet adjust which helps you to achieve the perfect position.Movement :-8/10It does pan from left to right and left to right. It's move very  smooth however some professional photo grapher will not find it very smooth.Holding :-9/10There is no default configuration to hold the mobile phones as it's specially designed for Cameras however You can  search for a bracket or an adapter to hold the mobile. These brackets are very cheap. You can get them for Rs.150 to Rs.200 through online/local market.Finally it's a very good product at this price range.

Summary: Nearly a must have for any amateur camera or video recording work---------------The great:1) No less than 10 kinds of adjustments2) Can sit at just over a foot height and can go upto 4.5 feet3) Easy to carry: The bag to carry is very good and the tripod itself shrinks to a carryable size to carry in the bag4) Must have for youtubers. The stability it provides is very good for youtube videos.5) Quality:  The quality of material is simply exceptional. I could drop it from about 5 feet height and it wont' break (not tried, but it feels that sturdy)---------------The good:1) Has level meter: But only for right left. Wish it had for front back also!---------------The not-so-good:1) No Universal Holder: If you plan to shoot video with mobile, you need a universal mobile holder bought separately.---------------Who is it for:1) If you are buying a video camera just go ahead and buy a tripod already.2) If you do any kind of video work, even on mobile phone use a tripod. Without tripod, the videos will be very jittery due to movement, even if you (or cameraman) have a very stable hand3) Photos: Needed only for photos that have long exposure (for example in the night). Or for long distance shots. In both of these cases a small movement in your hand will lead to blurry photos.

There is also an additional hook present in the middle which can be used to suspend weights in order to provide more stability in a windy environment.4. Easily holds my Nikon D3400 with both 18-55 & 70-300 lenses without any worry.5. Lightweight, hence great for travelling. The bag is also very handy.6. The bubble levels are pretty decent.7. Panning is also pretty smooth.8. Only downside is build quality of some parts and plastic are cheap, i hope it lasts.

The tripod is one of the best budget tripod. The matte finish it great and the overall fit and finish is great, the materials used feel premium and of high quality. It also has an inbuilt spirit level to see if the camera is straight/in level to the ground. The trip gets very high and allows you to take shots from a wide variety of heights. The pan is smooth and tilts are also smooth. Although a beginner wouldn't be able to take very smooth shots. You need some level of experience with panning and tilting for very smooth pans. The tripod also removable mounting screw so you don't have to screw in your camera everytime. The tripod is light and the carry bag allows you to easily take it to several places. Although I would have liked a bit more sturdy feeling when at Max Height. All in all it is a great purchase and nothing else can beat it in this price!

Its heavy and sturdy. Comes as three pieces, the head, the tripod and a padded bag.  Inside the bag, you have an user manual, spare camera shoe and allen keys.The tripod is real heavy. Approx 3kgs. Fully expanded, stands tall at about 5' 5". Add the head, it will reach about 6ft. The tripod has a level indicator and a small compass. The head has three level indicators. The only problem I saw is that, you can't store both tripod and head in the bag.The pistol grip is solid and apart from the quick release button for the shoe, there's also a screw to hold the shoe in place.Witb the pistol lever pressed, you get a 360 deg movement and be able to lock in any position.The centre rod can rise up another 10" or so... And it has a hook at the bottom to add weight or tie the tripod down if necessary. Also it can be removed and the pistol grip attached for low shots.Overall, bang for the buck.

Misleading informationâ€¢ I searched for a â€œmobile phone tripodâ€ and this product came up third in the search results.â€¢ It is an AmazonBasics product so I relied on the branding, did a quick scan of the specifications and ordered itâ€¢ When it was delivered, I realised the product was NOT compatible with mobile phonesâ€¢ When I read the product details again, I realised that on scrolling down 2 to 3 screens (in small font on my iPhone XS Max) thereâ€™s one line saying the product is not compatible with mobile phonesâ€¢ The Amazon app and the customer representative told me that the product can be replaced with the exact same product. That obviously doesnâ€™t help me.It was quite disappointing as I had relied on the Amazon brand and, to be honest, I felt cheated. I entered a very specific search. This product should not have appeared in the results. Also, the information about mobile phone incompatibility should have been highlighted.

I wonder where was Amazon hiding this monster for so many years. If you are looking for a tripod which stands solid and stiff in the price range, this is is the one. I am rating it 4 stars because of the bulky and awkward â€˜Pistol Gripâ€™ ball head and would want stress here if you're OK with buying a separate ball head, your search for a tall and sturdy tripod ends here.The only flaw is in the Pistol Grip head. The head that comes along is bulky and takes a lot of time to getting used to. I find it very awkward to use for panning shots. Itâ€™s really difficult to keep the camera at level or angle. The pistol grip adds an extra 9 inches to an already tall tripod. The movements are jerky. If the tension is tight, you really have to squeeze the grip hard to move it. If the tension is loose, the head may not hold position steady. Sure, they have a screw to adjust the tension, which may be toggled using a hex wrench (included), but is stressful anyways. The extra 9 inches of the ball head also gives a little wobbling movement. Further, the quick release plates on this ball head are proprietary and cannot be used on any other ball head. That is another annoying factor.Another factor that renders this tripod head useless for panning shots is that the centre column is immovable horizontally. You can slide it up and down to increase or decrease height, but you cannot rotate it horizontally. There is a groove in the column which locks it into place and the column cannot be rotated. Maybe, if the centre column had horizontal mobility, panning shots would have been easier. I call it a plus point as it practically disallows any kind of wobbling by the centre column.Coming back to ball head. For me, the better solution was to look for another ball head, and I did find one, which now adorns the dandy long legs of this monster (see image). The QR plate and holding clamp is 38mm Arca Swiss design, which makes it easier to switch with other ball heads with similar 38mm shoe clamp, without changing the plate.Some of the plastics feel a little cheap, but I choose to ignore, because at the end of the day the system stands rock solid and sturdy. Some may criticize it for the weight, but I say the weight is an added advantage for this tripod to stand stiff, especially in windy conditions. I have made bulb ramping long exposures on this stand, without having slightest of blur.So, if you don't care about weight and size, and you are OK with spending another 3k+ on a ball head, this is the tripod for you. Buying a separate ball head is basically a minor issue since all other tripod heads included with tripods in this price range are going to be similarly incapable.P.S. Maybe you will find the pistol grip handy and easy to use, I couldn't...

As a small youtuber i had no choice but go with a budget tripod, so after a lot of research and binge watching reviews i ordered this product.I was both scared and excited as there were mixed reviews about the quality of the product.But i was so relived after  i received the product, it came in good package and was in good condition.So i have been using it for the last 3 years or so (Not regularly).I use Nikon DSLR5300 for making youtube videos and this is the stand i have been using in all my videos.Now what do i think*This is absolutely fine for recording Youtube videos that are static (where you don't need to move around the cam)*It is not at all suitable for B rolls as it's budget product and feels clumsy.So if you are someone who wants a basic tripod to mount your DSLR cam and just record this is hands down the best at this price rangeIf you are more in to recording broll like videos where you need the help of a stable and smooth tripod this is not at all suitable for that.

It seemed like a fine product at first glance and I ordered without hesitation as it was Amazon Basics. I have had positive experience for amazon basics products. But this was not the case.I had to return it within a day only. It was not able to hold a DSLR firmly at an upwards angle. This was with a normal 18-55mm so not too much weight. I thought that the product must be defective so I decided to go for a replacement.As it turns out, that was not the case with that piece. The new piece had the same problem. Tripod was not able to hold it firmly. Even the movement of auto-focus motor was sufficient to make lens move from it's angle.  This was enough to ruin photos especially the long exposure ones.Packaging:This product comes with wrapped in plastic inside a decent cover. Cover is good for overall use. However the box that it came in was damaged the second time. It was torn at many places but I didn't mind that too much.I had to return it again and finally ask for a refund. I would suggest go for something more sturdier even if it is expensive.

The XT-200 is typically a successor of Fujifilmâ€™s entry-level mirrorless camera XT-100 which was launched more than a year ago and its pricing sits just below the mid-ranger XT-30. Although there are various upgrades over the previous generation, being a vlogger one upgrade that I consider major is its capability to shoot 4K videos up to 30 FPS as compared to just 15 FPS with XT-100. To go through more differences and new features keep reading.1. XT-200 sports a 3.5-inch -90 to 180 degree rotatable LCD as compared to a 3-inch 3-way tilt LCD in XT-100. The new 3.5-inch LCD supports a 16:9 video playback instead of 3:2 in that of the XT-100.2. Both XT-200 and XT-100 come equipped with 24.2 MP aps-c sensors but the one on XT-200 is a copper wired sensor. Though itâ€™s hard to notice any major improvements while capturing still images.3. As compared to manual up-down navigation controls at the back of XT-100, XT-200 now equips a joystick control. Also, most of the controls are now on the touchscreen panel of XT-200 like Q button, dept sensor, aperture, and exposure adjustments. Thereâ€™s a complete changeover of UI in XT-200.4. XT-200 showcases some new functions like an improved digital stabilization mode called Digital Gimbal and an HDR movie mode that allows HDR video recording in high contrast situations on 1080p resolution at 30 FPS. Also, thereâ€™s a much better face and eye detection AF system in the new XT-200.5. XT-200 comes with a 3.5mm audio jack as compared to 2.5mm on XT-100. Also, thereâ€™s a USB type C port on XT-200 whereas XT-100 only supports standard USB.6. Both cameras come in a plastic body but XT-200 showcases a matte finish as compared to a shiny one on XT-100.7. XT-200 is designed to give a better grip with a hump in front side as compared to XT-100 where there was no such hump.8. XT-200 weighs significantly less at around 370 grams as compared to XT-100 which weighs around 450 grams.Cons:- Although there are some major improvements, I personally donâ€™t feel the huge price difference between XT-100 and XT-200 is justified.- Supports only 15 minutes video at 4K resolution.- At such a high price point Fujifilm shouldâ€™ve offered an X-Trans sensor instead of a CMOS sensor.In case youâ€™ve got some more bucks in your budget then X-T30 would be a great option to consider instead of upgrading to XT-200.P.S. I review products on amazon to help fellow customers in taking wise decisions and try to ensure that everyone's hard-earned money gets its full worth. It always makes my day to know that people find my reviews helpful. Feel free to mail me for any queries and follow me for more such informative reviews.

Seller: Appario RetailPrice: 58990\-Delivery: 2 days, Prime, BangalorePackage: Came in box pack, covering contentsReturnable: NO, 10 days replacement, but that too subject to Amazon terms!Note, only replacement if faulty is proved to customer care. If they are not convinced, you have to service it at service point only!. Better to buy locally if possible after thorough testing.Biggest disappointment is price dropped almost 9K after I bought. It hit the lowest 49990/-, after I bought it. Very much disappointed!!!Box contains Camera, Lens kit, Bag, Basic manual, USB type C cable for charge, Battery and 16GB SDHC class-10No Battery charger unit provided.Things to know:~~~~~~~~~~~~~>>  Charging through USB cable via 2A adapter takes 2-3 hrs>>  Display is 3.5inch, articulated, huge and sharpest among any other camera even a segment above>>  Viewfinder is electronic, supports pictures and video preview as well, but some lag is noticeable, can't replace an optical viewfinder smoothness>>  Rated 275 shots in high quality, not tested>>  3-4 buttons and dials can be customizable, including some parts of touchscreen>>  Supports HDR caped at 1080p 25fps only, Gimbal mode caped at 1080p 30fps only!>>  Supports 4K 30fps only, HDR or gimbal mode are not supported at 4K video>>  Touch screen is not as 100% touch capable as smart phone. Mix of buttons is required!>> Somewhat slower compared to DSLR shooting speedFuji XT200 or Canon M50 or Sony 6100?~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~In the budget range of 40-60K, Canon M50 poses a tough competition. Sony is only good for auto-focus, rest is simply similar to others but they charge so much for the same. To decide between Canon M50 and XT200,>>  M50 has 4K crop factor and a big downside in 2020>>  M50 is 2 years old, XT200 is 6 months old>>  XT200 LCD is sharper, bigger and vivid>>  Gimbal mode and HDR supported in XT200, but only on 1080p>>  XT200 supports 120FPS 1080p slow motion, which is very good out of the box>>  425 Focus points in XT200 against 143 in M50>>  No USB charging in M50>> vM50 uses USB 2.0 while XT200 uses USB 3.0>>  Fuji lens are cheaper and expansion is easy>>  Picture quality and video quality is much better than mobile shooting (iPhone, S10, etc)Picture wise, there shouldn't be much difference, but there are lots of reason to get XT200 than M50, esp for those who prefer videos. Fuji XA7 is a low cost model, sold here at Amazon for ~39K. It has no viewfinder and lacks HDR, Gimbal mode, slow motion, etc.Disappointments:~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~>>  Camera price dropped sharply>>  Gets warmer soon (which seems normal)>>  Some live filters and editing features you can apply but seems more like gimmick like smart phones these days>>  Picture quality is good unless you start to zoom beyond 2x>>  Auto-focusing isn't faster in picture or video capture, Sony is better>> Stock LENS IS A JOKE & VERY AVERAGE!!!..Fuji a disappointmentIf you looking for upgrade over mobile shooting and considering ease of use, prefer this mirrorless cameras. If you still want to learn and earn, you can buy a good midrange DSLR for this price and still take amazing pics!Hope this helps

I got a product with an open box packing which was plastered. The product seemed okay inside but on close inspection I could find the country of origin of camera is Indonesia and the lens was from Philippines, while I was of the impression that the product would be from the Fujiâ€™s legacy factories in Japan. Itâ€™s dubious Amazon doesnâ€™t give the country of origin for their products sold in the platform, giving the sellers the opportunity to cheat people by selling a low end product desguised as the original factory claimed. Itâ€™s worthwhile to note that flip kart and tatacliq specify the make factory and country clearly on their website. I got the product not of my colour choice, that I could get a refund. But even if I came to know the product they delivered is from another country not expected, I think I wouldâ€™ve got a refund if they delivered the right choice of color for me. So beware and ensure the product comes from Japan itself before you buy it. At the time of writing, I had a better offer from tatacliq and they give the product originally from Fuji Japan factory...note that my seller here was Price..Perfect

I'm a beginner when it comes to photography. I bought the X-T200 after a month of research (online- YouTube and other forums), I compared this with the Sony A6100 and Canon M50 and found this more to my liking. You can always compare the three (or any other) cameras on any website so I will leave the specifics out of this review.First of all, the camera looks premium and is built very well. It has a presence. It's ergonomically shaped and is quite comfortable to hold. It has a well lit EVF and a 3.5" screen which can be turned on/ off. It has a front aperture dial, a rear shutter speed command dial and a dial on the left side which can be configured- I have set it for ISO.The battery seems to be the only issue for me and drains a bit fast but I have the Bluetooth on so probably that's why.The camera comes with a beautiful bag, a 16 GB memory card, a strap etc.Anyway, the pictures I'm attaching are all shot in manual mode and it responds quite well. The dials are a little stiff and small so that might take some getting used to. I'm really happy with this device and can't wait to try it with different lenses.

Since most of the reviews revolve around comparing this to a DSLR, I guess my take on it comes from a size perspective. You also have this sony alpha mirror less camera here  but its too expensive currently.I cannot take a DSLR hiking, they're simply too bulky and too heavy to justify the space in my pack. When I looked at replacing my Canon, I went out to find something that I could get that was lightweight without sacrificing the quality of the images I had grown used to with the DSLR. This had an aesthetic I really liked and the features I was looking for as well. It doesn't look like a cheap point and shoot with a bigger lens strapped to the front. The controls are perfectly fine for me and are more second nature since I've spent a lot of time behind it. Like anything new one gets, you have to get used to it. I find the colors on pictures I take with this camera come out much better overall compared to my old Canon. It isn't excessively difficult to use, and I don't find the menu cluttered at all. The camera is very light and very small for what performance you can squeeze out of it, its footprint is about the same as my Samsung Galaxy s10e. The camera is mostly just wider with the lens mounted.I cannot attest to the video features as I do not use them.My only gripes about this camera are the kit lens and the materials, mostly the kit lens, and those are never really spectacular anyways. It just seems to be adequate for most circumstances, without ever being the "perfect" choice for a scene. Its easily replaced however, so you can learn on it before getting a new lens better suited to your tastes. That lightweight I enjoy comes at the cost of the materials unfortunately. The camera is VERY plastic-y and does not feel like it would survive a fall. I don't drop my cameras, but I'm not sure my old DSLR would have survived either. Better materials and weatherproofing would have meant a higher cost anyways, and that would've defeated the purpose of this for me.All in all, I find this camera perfectly suited for what I needed. I needed a lightweight, high image quality camera, and the Fujifilm XT200 got me there. Your mileage may vary though depending on your skill level, experience with much more expensive cameras, and overall attitude.

The Fujifilm X-T200 is an inexpensive mirrorless camera that uses the company's X-mount. It replaces the X-T100, a camera that seemed promising when it was announced, but whose sluggish performance was a letdown. Thankfully, Fujifilm has put a lot of work into making the X-T200 both more responsive and full-featured.Key specifications:24MP APS-C sensor with Bayer color filter and faster readout speedsUpdated hybrid autofocus system with 425 phase-detect pointsRefined ergonomics, lighter body3.5", 16:9 fully articulating LCD with 2.76 million dotsEasy-to-use touch menus2.36M-dot OLED viewfinder with 0.62x magnification8 fps burst shootingNew 'Clarity' effectOversampled 4K video with no cropAudio level controlsMicrophone and headphone inputs (latter via USB-C adapter)New Digital Gimbal and HDR video options.conclusionThe Fujifilm X-T200 is quite a bit different than its predecessor, the X-T100. While the X-T100 tried to be a scaled down version of the X-T20, Fujifilm failed to pull it off, for a variety of reasons.The X-T200 tries to be a scaled down X-T30 and more. It's a camera that should suit both amateurs who want a lot of physical controls, and smartphone upgraders who like the familiarity of touchscreen operation. And this time, Fujifilm has succeeded.From most angles, the X-T200 looks like many other Fujifilm X-series cameras, like the X-T30 and X-T3/X-T4. It has a DSLR-style body, plenty of dials on the top (though, thankfully, not as many as higher-end models) and an electronic viewfinder. What makes the X-T200 stand out from the more expensive cameras is its gigantic and bright fully articulating 3.5" touchscreen.

Here are a few things to note before you make a decision1. This is a nice option for anyone looking to get better pictures and videos compared to your Smartphone, especially if you are a content creator2. Don't get discouraged by the 15 min limit for 4K videos, because unless you are creating videos for commercial purposes, full HD resolution is way more than sufficient. Now, if you do need 4K, 15min is quite a bit for one shot.3. The XC kit lens provided is not the best option to get the most out of this camera. Considering upgrading to the significantly better XF 18-55F2.8-4 or a fast prime lens (16/23/35 - depending on your needs).4. If you are willing to spend another 30k, the X-T30 comes with the kit 18-55 option, but you will not get a fully articulating, screen which may be a deal-breaker.At this price point, you will no go wrong with the T200!Best all-round prime lens (subjective): Fuji 23mmF2 or Tokina 23mmF1.4 (just released)An alternative, comparable camera at this price point: Sony A6100An alternative option if you are only looking at casual photography: iPhone 11Do check out my other reviews on YT (Home Savvy Tech). I will be reviewing a Fuji camera in the near future.

They give a special buy-one-get-one-free. I ordered two, but got 4 (two extras). I should have ordered one and would get the two I require.It says "Material from Korea". Product is  made in India.The biggest weakness of the product is the fit. The 4 corners do not perfectly  fit the frame of the LCD screen. The  fitted screen guard does not look smooth at the 4 edges. Looks unstuck. It looks likes it's a fit for another camera though it mentions 5100 in the Amazon listing.The LCD visibility and clarity is okay, but the fit is not.I can now understand why they have given 1 free....effectively making it a Rs. 150/- priced product. The better brands sell at 299 - 399.Will  not buy this brand again.

I am pretty happy with the purchasePositives :1) They have 2 varieties of the green screen cloth - I got the thicker one, which is the higher GSM, and it makes for a really good green screen and creates a pretty seamless virtual background.2) The colour is exactly as you can see in this picture, and I didn't need to iron it. It works just fine with the way you can see.3) The only virtual backdrop I have been using it for is with zoom.4) The size of the cloth is as described....what you see in the uploaded picture, its bigger than that.The stand is also really good quality..It may take a bit to balance it properly if you don't extend the height of the stand, all the way up. In the picture, the stand isn't fully extended vertically or horizontally...which means that there is a scope to take it higher or wider as per your requirement.5) The stand is pretty easy to assemble.Seller Review6) I had a lot of questions before buying the product and the seller was very prompt and efficient in replying.7) In fact, one of the items got left out during delivery, and they made sure to deliver it promptly, once notified.Overall, happy with the purchase!

I'm giving this product an absolute 10/10 for multiple reasons. 1. The packaging was exceptionally well done. Plus it comes in a neat handy bag for carrying it around if you ever travel with it. 2. The cloth material is massive in size and the one you see in the pic is actually folded to half size. 3. The material is way more solid than some other sellers on Amazon and is perfect for green screen editing and photo shoots. 4. The stand setup was easy as pie and was just perfect for different lengths and room sizes. Also height adjustable so pretty damn customizable with length and height. In fact, in the pic I skipped using one rod so you get the picture. 5. Those lovely metal clamps to be used at the top are a blessing and make attaching and removing the cloth easy. You can also use the cloth loop to make a more permanent setup or use the clamps if you want to switch between the different colored cloths. Black and white. Also. Minor detail but I loved it because the clamps also have rubber padding at the sharp edges making the clamp itself perfect.For this price. After experiencing the poor quality of other budget options on Amazon, I highly recommend this one. You can't get anything more professional than this kit for this low a price. Thank you seller!! ðŸ˜ You made my day

So anyhow this camera was suppose to be a big improvement for me.Just in case you are planning it to buy now, wait for the canon full frame mirrorless instead.The overall experience of the camera is great. Canon 6D Mark II is the most anticipated camera after 5D Mark IV in recent times, whilst we have been expecting its launch from October 2016. Finally, I have the pleasure of both using and reviewing it, which is quite a pleasing experience till now. The introduction of 6D Mark II came after a long wait of 5 years since the inception of 6D, thereby packed with much changes and technological advancements.::::::::::::::::::::  Why 6D Mark II ?  ::::::::::::::::::::Whenever there is a launch of the new model, we are faced with an ever gripping question â€“ Should I buy it?Before elaborating on it, I would like you to know two things if you are sticking to Canon:a) 5D Mark III â€“ Almost unavailable in the market.b) 5D Mark IV â€“ Costs almost double than 6D Mark II.::::::::::::::::::::  Positives  ::::::::::::::::::::After my hands on the device and using it for few weeks, I am quite satisfied with it. Some of the noticeable advantages of the Mark II are summarized below:1) Extremely Cost Efficient Full Frame Camera  -  6D Mark II is the most cost-effective DSLR among all the Canon EOS Full Frame devices and stands tall with technological advancements.2) Significant Technological Upgrades  -  There have been significant technological upgrades as compared to 6D model and its presence is felt with each passing click. The changes are:i) Resolution: Mark II flaunts 26.2MP, an increase from 20.6MP.ii) Digital Imaging Integrated Circuit (DIGIC): There has been an upgrade to DIGIC 7, up from the available DIGIC 5+ in 6D. DIGIC 7 is much efficient in the handling of the heavy image file, thereby saving them to the memory much faster than DIGIC 5+.iii) Focus Points: 45 autofocus points (all cross type), a jump from 11 autofocus points (centre cross type). However, the autofocus points are seemed to be crammed at the centre, like all other full frame cameras. Naturally, the presence of all cross type helps in fast focusing.iv) Frames per Second (fps): Both the Canonâ€™s 6D supports 1080p recording, but, the fps rate has been raised from 30fps to 60fps.v) Weather Resistant: 6D Mark II has debuted the weather resistant feature which is a â€˜cherry on the cakeâ€™.3) ISO - Mark II has normal ISO in the range of 100 to 40,000 and it can be extended to the range of 50 to 1,02,4000. The video ISO, however, has the range in between 100 to 25,600.In most of the cases, the noise will be negligible while taking pictures in ISO 1600 and even the clicks taken in ISO range of 3200 to 6400 will be usable for most purposes. However, it is to be noted that the option of using the pictures on occasions will continue to be diminished as we increase the ISO from 1600. Many use the ETTR (Expose To The Right) strategy to lower the noise in pictures, however, doing so can have slight issues in Dynamic Range, in comparison to other DSLRs. I was expecting Mark II to handle the Dynamic Range better, but it is not the case.4) Availability of Remote Shutter App  -  Canon has application both for Android and Apple devices which communicates with the camera via Wi-Fi. You can use the app for camera remote, image viewing, to name a few. It is indeed a positive approach of Canon in â€˜delighting us alwaysâ€™.5) Lightest in the Class  -  The total weight of the body along with the battery stands at mere 765gms. According to the Canon website, it is the lightest DSLR in the EOS Full Frame line up. Having a light full frame camera in everyday life is such a relief that I cannot sketch my excitement in words.6) Vari-Angle Touch Panel  -  The Mark II is packed with a vari-angle touch panel which has multiple benefits. It helps in varied angle photos, while touch panel has packed in ease of the touch.7) Digital 5 Axis Image Stabilization  -  Mark II is also pampered with Digital 5 Axis Image Stabilization which makes it quite easy to record video, nullifying the effects of unintentional shakes, both vertical or horizontal. It is highly useful while recording at 1080p, in both 30 and 60 fps.::::::::::::::::::::  Negatives  ::::::::::::::::::::Even the best performing devices have flaws in it and these are some of the shortcomings, I cannot seem to ignore:1) Missing Inbuilt Flash  --  Following the trend, the Mark II lacks an inbuilt flash which did not come to me as a surprise. Though it does not affect my decision of owning it as I do not prefer using on-camera flash under any situation, it might be disappointing to few.2) Menu Driven Controls  --  Mark II lacks dedicated control buttons and is infused with menu driven controls. Usually, the professionals who are involved in photography for a long time will surely find bit uneasy using the menu-driven controls as it will not only delay their performance but also will lead to frustration. We wish for hassle-free experience while using a camera and this feature has surely not helped the cause.3) Single SD Card Slot  --  Not having a second slot clearly hinders the peace of mind and we have to constantly keep track of the storage. While the liberty of saving different image formats in separate cards is shattered, not having a backup of the picture is tad terrifying.4) Missing 4K Videography  --  I was in high hopes for the Mark II launch and hands-on with 4K videography was one the vital reason for it. It surely came to me as a shock that Mark II has no 4K videography, but, taking the price bracket into consideration it surely doesnâ€™t make me disappointed.::::::::::::::::::::  Miscellaneous  ::::::::::::::::::::These are some of the features which I could not include either add in pros or cons:1) Mark II has backward compatibility with lenses from past 30 years, with the exception of APS-C cameraâ€™s EF-S / EF-M lenses.2) There is no option for adjusting LCDâ€™s Brightness but is sufficiently bright for most occasions.3) The image quality of Mark II seems identical to the range of 5D S / SRs. It is to be however noted that the hard-core professionals, using their professional skills might find some enhancements which will have no effect on either normal or semi-professional user.::::::::::::::::::::  Conclusion  ::::::::::::::::::::Taking all points into consideration, I would term this a good buy. The close competitor to Canon 6D Mark II will be Nikon D750, which is a 3 yearsâ€™ old model. In my opinion, Nikon D750 produces the same picture quality, despite being cheaper than Canon Mark II. However, the video quality on 6D Mark II is much better than D750.It will be an ideal buy for those who are considering owning a Canon full frame camera. Also, one who wishes to upgrade from 6D can definitely think of it as an option due to the added advantages as discussed in the review.:::::::  If you are in need of clarification or have other questions, please feel free to contact me via â€˜Send an Emailâ€™ button on my profile. Additionally, you can also comment on this review to get your query answered.  :::::::

This is my review about the product received and initial testing of about 1000 photos and a few videos.First the package - As shown in the pictures and described. No complains.Delivery time - spot on, received it under 48 hours of order.Packaging - Decent enough, no complainsSealed box - checkInside the box - Camera, lens, battery, charger, strap. everything there and intact.Warranty - registered the products without any issues for a 2 year warranty.Initial impressions of the camera and lens.Boy is it heavy!!!The Camera and lens together feel heavy if you are coming from ceop sensor cameras. Good heavy I mean. Feels solid.The camera menu takes some getting used to though. But the touch screen makes it easy to navigate around different settingsThe Lens! Simply wow. The flexibility you get with this lens is just awesome. Without compromising on image quality at any focal length (unless you pixel peep around the edges at 24 or 105).Images are crisp and clean with great color science. Dont need to edit much with colours post. Although the shadows and highlights may need some tweaking when shooting low light. Also noticed over exposure when shooting Aperture priority, need pulling down during or post clicking.Get a 70 MBps plus UHS 1 card for burst, else the lag is significant.Decent Videos at 1080 24, 30 and 60. Not much to talk about here.Will try and follow up with a more detailed review once I have used it enough.

I was looking for a tripod / monopod to support a 300 mm tele lens. A cheap aluminium tripod I already have does not have the stability to hold a heavy telephoto lens. So I started looking for a stronger monopod.This monopod is solid and claims to hold up to 10kg. It is sturdy to hold the tele lens. Now I have decided to use the existing shaky tripod for the flash.Prolite monomod is great value for money. Under Rs. 900, you don't expect it to offer what a Rs. 9000 imported tripod or monopod will. The overall structure is strong. Finish is so so. The rubber grip is loose. The metal is strong, but the plastic clamps look a bit ordinary. But I am not looking for a monopod that will last a lifetime. I am looking for something that is cheap and good. So I give it five stars.On its own, the product is self sufficient. However, I attached a ball head. It works well.On a 300 telephoto for birding, I would need 1/500 of a second handheld shots. With this monopod I can go as slow as 340th of a second to get a much steadier shot than 1/500. I am not a pro. If you are an amateur with little money, go for it. If you are a pro or an amateur loaded with cash, buy the imported stuff. Don't buy fake Indian stuff with the foreign brand. This is at least, proudly Indian, not fake.

So, I love most things about this product. The gorilla arm works nice, albeit a bit shorter than I hoped for. The mounts are interchangeable. Can freely move the top part 360deg and lock in place.I bought this to use my phone as a webcam during the pandemic. Here's where the problem starts: the included phone holder is pathetic.It has this elastic mechanism to grip your phone which is the culprit. It's way too tight! It's not easy to loosen it to insert your phone or to take your phone out and I struggle everytime I have to do it. I use my phone with a clear silicone case and I didnt remove it when using it with this holder. After many times using it, one day, this tight grip caused the glass on the backside of my phone to break. Cracks appeared right at the point where the holder was gripping my phone at. Luckily, my display was spared but I've avoided using it since then.So, be very careful about your usage before buying this. I'd recommend getting another phone holder for use with this or trying a different product.To the manufacturer: probably don't use this tight latching mechanism, replace it with an adjustable manual locking mechanism.

I was looking for a tripod / monopod to support a 300 mm tele lens. A cheap aluminium tripod I already have does not have the stability to hold a heavy telephoto lens. So I started looking for a stronger monopod.This monopod is solid and claims to hold up to 10kg. It is sturdy to hold the tele lens. Now I have decided to use the existing shaky tripod for the flash.Prolite monomod is great value for money. Under Rs. 900, you don't expect it to offer what a Rs. 9000 imported tripod or monopod will. The overall structure is strong. Finish is so so. The rubber grip is loose. The metal is strong, but the plastic clamps look a bit ordinary. But I am not looking for a monopod that will last a lifetime. I am looking for something that is cheap and good. So I give it five stars.On its own, the product is self sufficient. However, I attached a ball head. It works well.On a 300 telephoto for birding, I would need 1/500 of a second handheld shots. With this monopod I can go as slow as 340th of a second to get a much steadier shot than 1/500. I am not a pro. If you are an amateur with little money, go for it. If you are a pro or an amateur loaded with cash, buy the imported stuff. Don't buy fake Indian stuff with the foreign brand. This is at least, proudly Indian, not fake.
I use it to stablize my videos. A gymbal is an overkill for shooting activities where the camera need not move about a lot yet should be able to quickly setup from one to another.

Bought this charger, skeptical about the quality of the charger. Replaced camelion charger which lasted around 5 years with this one.This one charges cells individually unlike many chargers which charges cells in pair. The batteries now retain charge longer than with the previous faulty one. Using this to charge Eneloop and Camelion NiMH precharged batteries for more than one month without any issues.Charging speed is fast compared to previous model. This seems to have auto cut off as the charging indicator stops blinking when completely charged.

Overall the build quality is good. Led indicator lights are perfect in brightness.Most important:You can not charge single cell in this charger. the charging will start only when you insert two cells.Also the case is same with 3. The third one will not charge until there are 4 cells. I use an extra spare cell just to complete the circuit.

Made in: PRC (Public Republic of CHINA)How many times I got my batteries charged with this charger: ZERO TIMESComments: No instructions about charging,For how long one should keep the four batteries placed together for completely charging.Or For how long one battery should be kept in charging, since this not the "AUTO-CUT" Charger.Generally it is 10 hours for four batteries,if put together in charger, I did the same, Result: All four batteries are spoiled and charger's charging light is off,and it's dead.Recommendation: Never Purchase this item. Go for a charger,that has "Auto-Cut" option,when batteries are fully charged.

Actual results -AA 2800 mAH  x 4 batteries takes 6.3 Hours for full charge...AA 2800 mAH  x 2 batteries takes 2.5 Hours for full charge...Battery temperature is high, it's obvious with rapid charges...Faster than Envie ECR-20

As another reviewer has also pointed out this charger overheats and a burning smell is clearly discernible after it is put into the power socket.  Envie batteries meant for this charger take 4 to 7 hours to recharge but the burning smell and overheating is in evidence within an hour of charging.  The first charger I purchased was replaced by Amazon on request but the same problem is there with replacement charger.  Therefore, I can only conclude this is a fundamental flaw with this charger.  Given my experience thus far, it is not unreasonable to assume the charger will overheat and burn out after a short period. A product redesign is needed.  As the saying goes, caveat emptor  or buyer beware.

So today i tested with 2100mah envie Ni-Mh batteries.. it took almost 1hr to show full charge symbol.. so i thought great its fast.. but then i switched off and on in a gap of 10sec.. charging startrd again with 1point.. and charged for 1hr.. now showing full charge but batteries got heated and i took risk and turned on again same problem started from 1point.. but this time i removed.. so my conclusion is there is no auto cutoff there is no battery charge detection.. waste of money

I hope to write a long term review. Right now after about a month of usage the battery is working well, holding charge enough to power my camcorders, walkmans, and world band tuners for weeks. The charge cycle frequency is over three weeks with charge depleting as per usage. The  charger seems to be working well to though heats up a bit, though I guess that has more to do with the ambient 45 degree summer heat right now.I know some other sites are offering this at a lower price of INR 500 or less for 4 2100 mah battery and including a charger, but I chose Amazon even though they were higher priced at INR 600 just to be sure that I get the genuine item, which I seem to have. I remember when I used to buy these in the eighties and nineties at a much lower priced point to power my walkmans and cameras,  but I guess those days are for memories now. My feedback to the manufacturer of this product is that include a timing circuit inside the charger like some Sony charges do which cut off charge voltage after a preset time of say 12 hours, as a slower charge and deplete rate extends battery life, and with that feature that Sony chargers offer but not Envie ECR 20, one needn't worry about having accidently forgotten the charger attached to the power terminal and returning home to find swollen batteries.

Many people are complaining for its other models as they were transformer based or rectifier based converting AC to DC, EC11 MC model takes DC as input from your mobile chargers hence no heating or any other issue with it also the speedx model is a fast charge type charger so can charge your batteries full in an hour or less and due to its trickle charge property batteries are protected from overcharging and heating issues. Easy to carry and easy to use.
Batteries are in bad shape. Dents and scratches are found on every battery. Disappointed.

The product has a nice design, looks relatively well made "from the outside". It has two indicators led that are red in colour. This is where the confusion starts. The two red led are on the two sides of the device which may house 4 AAA or 4 AA cells. So, first when one of the LEDs lit what does it mean one cell is charging or two cells are charging? Once the cell charges to full capacity the LEDs don't change colour. So it's difficult to tell when the cells have fully charged. If you can ignore this then the product gets 4 stars from me as it also has a over charge protection, i however do not like this  confusion hence the 3 stars

It's a decent charger, in this price. Do not expect hi end features like auto cut (upon full charge) or individual unit charge. The charge output is low @ 150 mah meaning it can charge both NiCad & NiMh units.The inside consists of a rudimentary circuit, involving primarily a transformer. It heats up rather alarmingly, so I drilled 4 holes to enable heat dissipation. DO NOT LEAVE IT ON CHARGE OVERNIGHT. Rather, use it for two hours followed by a half hour break, about 5 times for AAA & 8 for AA (depending on either's specific mah). Overcharging is BAD for both, especially NiMh.It's a GOOD buy considering the price.

Cons:1. Its a dumb charger. It will not cut off automatically2. Transformer inside heats abnormally which is a fire hazard3. You cannot charge a single cell. You have to charge 2 and that too in the adjacent slot4. Detrimental to battery life and charge cyclesPros: Just one. It charges while it lastsAmazon wont refund even if product is defective and will die in the long run. Better buy Panasonic/Eneloop charger and batteries and get peace of mind. Works flawlessly. Envie is cheap and useless

ERC-20 MC.It's a fair product. Doesn't do much. Doesn't do less. Good at doing one job that is charging. Biggest turn off is the indicators. They stay lit all the time don't expect them to turn off when battery is full. Don't expect super fast charging.I think mc stands for multi connector. This guy supports USB-C and micro usb charging ports.Good for household use.Not recommended for professionals.

During last 5 year i always searched for a Battery Charger that come upto my expectation, as being a Dad of 3 year kid , i always need lot of batteries and always look for battery charger option but always come out with a faulty charger, but my search really got end with this charger. its LCD display is just awesome.  Its a must buy if you are a regular battery charger needy.

I like the product very much, performance is pretty fair, so is price. i charged my 1900 mah battery cell somewhere between 1-2 hours not more than that, 2 cells at a time, only disadvantage i felt if they provide percentage indicator would have been much better. But still thats not a main issue. I still like the product, may be in future 2nd version of speedster company will provide that too in affordable price. I hope this review will also help other customers.

Envie - what a letdown! The batteries stopped holding charge very quickly... 2800MaH lol - nonsense. Completely dead batteries will show 3/4th charge on the speedster. You can keep the batteries charging for a day and then it might have enough power to run a remote control but little else. Save your money and buy a better product from Panasonic or Duracell. I don't know why I bought so many of their batteries and chargers based on some of the positive reviews here - should have taken my advice from the critical negative ones which share a similar viewpoint to this review. In a nutshell they are selling low performance products with no QA of any kind. You have been warned.

Here is a tip, for those of you who are facing heating issues. Try charging two batteries at a time instead of 4.For AA 2800mah capacity, no need to charge more than 45mins. Battery will reach full charge. For AAA batteries you can charge an hour.Usage: i use these batteries for playing games with my xbox one controller. Even after extensive gaming sessions over the weekend the battery still has juice left for more.If you are using these for digi cam your mileage may vary. I am yet to test this on digi cam. Majority of people are using smartphones these days. So professionals would be the ones in need if these for photography.Conclusin: All in all its a good purchase if you follow the above mentioned instructions.

Bought this charger, skeptical about the quality of the charger. Replaced camelion charger which lasted around 5 years with this one.This one charges cells individually unlike many chargers which charges cells in pair. The batteries now retain charge longer than with the previous faulty one. Using this to charge Eneloop and Camelion NiMH precharged batteries for more than one month without any issues.Charging speed is fast compared to previous model. This seems to have auto cut off as the charging indicator stops blinking when completely charged.

Overall the build quality is good. Led indicator lights are perfect in brightness.Most important:You can not charge single cell in this charger. the charging will start only when you insert two cells.Also the case is same with 3. The third one will not charge until there are 4 cells. I use an extra spare cell just to complete the circuit.

Made in: PRC (Public Republic of CHINA)How many times I got my batteries charged with this charger: ZERO TIMESComments: No instructions about charging,For how long one should keep the four batteries placed together for completely charging.Or For how long one battery should be kept in charging, since this not the "AUTO-CUT" Charger.Generally it is 10 hours for four batteries,if put together in charger, I did the same, Result: All four batteries are spoiled and charger's charging light is off,and it's dead.Recommendation: Never Purchase this item. Go for a charger,that has "Auto-Cut" option,when batteries are fully charged.

Actual results -AA 2800 mAH  x 4 batteries takes 6.3 Hours for full charge...AA 2800 mAH  x 2 batteries takes 2.5 Hours for full charge...Battery temperature is high, it's obvious with rapid charges...Faster than Envie ECR-20

As another reviewer has also pointed out this charger overheats and a burning smell is clearly discernible after it is put into the power socket.  Envie batteries meant for this charger take 4 to 7 hours to recharge but the burning smell and overheating is in evidence within an hour of charging.  The first charger I purchased was replaced by Amazon on request but the same problem is there with replacement charger.  Therefore, I can only conclude this is a fundamental flaw with this charger.  Given my experience thus far, it is not unreasonable to assume the charger will overheat and burn out after a short period. A product redesign is needed.  As the saying goes, caveat emptor  or buyer beware.

So today i tested with 2100mah envie Ni-Mh batteries.. it took almost 1hr to show full charge symbol.. so i thought great its fast.. but then i switched off and on in a gap of 10sec.. charging startrd again with 1point.. and charged for 1hr.. now showing full charge but batteries got heated and i took risk and turned on again same problem started from 1point.. but this time i removed.. so my conclusion is there is no auto cutoff there is no battery charge detection.. waste of money

One can charge 4 AA batteries or 4 AAA batteries or combination maximum of 4 at a time.2) The charing indicator is the best of it.3) Chargins speed is also alright to me. For 2500mah it took 3 hours

I hope to write a long term review. Right now after about a month of usage the battery is working well, holding charge enough to power my camcorders, walkmans, and world band tuners for weeks. The charge cycle frequency is over three weeks with charge depleting as per usage. The  charger seems to be working well to though heats up a bit, though I guess that has more to do with the ambient 45 degree summer heat right now.I know some other sites are offering this at a lower price of INR 500 or less for 4 2100 mah battery and including a charger, but I chose Amazon even though they were higher priced at INR 600 just to be sure that I get the genuine item, which I seem to have. I remember when I used to buy these in the eighties and nineties at a much lower priced point to power my walkmans and cameras,  but I guess those days are for memories now. My feedback to the manufacturer of this product is that include a timing circuit inside the charger like some Sony charges do which cut off charge voltage after a preset time of say 12 hours, as a slower charge and deplete rate extends battery life, and with that feature that Sony chargers offer but not Envie ECR 20, one needn't worry about having accidently forgotten the charger attached to the power terminal and returning home to find swollen batteries.

Its 2019, and Sony has come out with a camera without IBIS.Pros:facial recognition and tracking have been improved.New Processor.The 6000 series overheating issue has been resolved.No 29-minute recording issues.Cons:1) Sony, we need a side flip articulated screen.2) The Flip which 6400 has is upward which is of no use if mike is attached at the top.3)No IBIS.4) Why the hell has it been priced so high? It's 899 USD, it is supposed to 400 USD cheaper than the 6500, why the insane pricing?5)Not worth buying at this price point.6) No useful for recording in those amazing sigma lenses, so basically buy the expensive Sony prime and zoom lenses and pay extra for the OSSA big thumbs down sony. First disappointment of 2019 from Sony.

Sample unedited images attached.Bought it after going through lot of reviews. Looking for a compact dslr quality camera with good features and mainly 4k video recording w/o any time limit.Was confuses b/w this and Fujifilm. Was really into the fuji retro look and there color effect but bought it due to offers in Amazon great India sale.Bought it just before our Diwali holiday and explored it throughout the trip and believe me no regrets. It has lot of customization related to the buttons and dials. Images come really good.If you can use the settings then many a times there is no need for editing as well.You can save them in raw as well with jpeg.On highest quality the size of on jpeg is around 14-15 mb.I bought it mainly to shoot my videos and the quality is just amazing.View finder is good and it has proximity sensor so screen turns of when you move near to view finder which is really good.There is a recording mode and a dedicated recording button which enables you to record any time. Sound is also clear and w/o any distortion or lag.Another plus is it's wireless connectivity. You can transfer the images and videos wirelessly over wifi through it's app that too in full quality and size. So if you want to share the images or videos instantly then it's a big plus. Then app can act as a remote also to click pics but you can't record videos with app.I hope they will bring that feature in future update.Build quality is superb it feels amazing in hand and is really compact(after using Nikon D5100).One major drawback is the screen tilt functionality. Not sure what sony was thinking while designing it. Even our Nikon D5100 which is like 9 years old as a side flip and rotatable screen which is way more convenient then this one.Second thing is I would really like if they have provided pause functionality while taking videos.Other thing is no seprate charger and small battery.Overall I am quite happy with the quality and performance.

Directly going to pros and cons :Pros: 1. Light weight and easy to carry.2. Amazing atufocus and af points.3. Image quality is top notch.4. Video recording is a bliss with tilt up screen.5. Great burst mode.Cons: 1. Expensive, like really expensive.2. Sometimes it feels uncomfortable to hold.4. The settings menu is loooooong, u need to spend some time getting used to it. Overall verdict : great camera overall for vloggers and also for still images, with the amount of lenses available for sony e mount you can create amazing compositions.

Must buy if this fits in your budget. Can talk a lot about the SW features which are way ahead of the dslr features, but I will leave that to many reviews on youtube or reddit.A special mention for eye tracking feature. For a perfect shot in dslr it needs atleast 10 takes in some cases, but this one needs one take due to the algorithms available.At a first glance, the pros don't weigh enough for the price tag, but if you can push up your budget, boy you will not regret the purchase. If you have used a dslr and planning for a switch, go for it blindly, you can notice the difference clearly the moment you hold it and start shooting.Also sony lens are costly compared to the other options available in the market, so you might have to be prepared for that. If you are convinced for a mirrorless camera and can spend more, checkout alpha a7 as well which has full frame sensor.

I am not a professional in this field, so whatever I am writing is what I want in a camera and if it is really worth it.This is my first camera, and before it, I was using my one plus 3 to shoot videos for my channel. Definitely there is no comparison between both of them, but during the purchase, I was a bit confused between Canon eos 200 M2 and a6400. To save my money I wanted to go with 200 m2 but the focus tracking system of A6400 is absolutely amazing and being a maker I want my camera to track my hands not the objects lying around onto the workbench and in that case, A6400 never fails. Sometimes I am 3D printing some work and want my camera to follow the printer nozzle and it never disappoints. The slight downfall is that you cant use the touch screen to navigate into the menu page but my menu tab helps you to keep your most-used menus in first priority. So for me its never been a barrier. If you want a camera and object tracking focusing is not your priority then you can go with canon 200 M2, but if it's your first priority like me then sony A6400 never ever going to disappoint you. Overall for me A6400 definitely worth the money spend on it.

Ok the DSLR Giant Canon have launched 1 more entry level DSLR. Actually i bought this camera for my friend. Does this camera worth 31K. Lets seePROS1.  Its easy to use2. Decent battery backup3. Live mode operation is not lagging.CONS1. While focusing the DSLR is making too much noise and its the kind of annoying that u will lose interest in taking photos.2. No shortcut or assigned button to change F stop (aperture). A manufacturer who is keeping dedicated button for changing the ISO have to thing about the importance of aperture.3. You can't change the focusing point by pressing the round dial in the system, if u press it some other setup will open up.4. The output image quality is actually not mind blowing.5. White balance- Use it if u want to take risk6. Main issue. If u use camera flash to snap a pic during focusing it will flicker like anything and it will annoy and irritate the subject7. Noise Noise Noise. Whatever low ISO you use noise will b there and when i went to service center to ask about this they were saying use a prime lens to get good output.I am a Nikon user i have Nikon D3400. I compared both cameras by taking same images with same settings in manual mode. The output from Nikon is better than Canon 1500D.In one word if want to push photography to next level from using a Point and Shoot or mobile camera to DSLR Or to learn the whole DSLR setting go for it (only with a mindset to change the camera in 1 or 2 years). As canon accessories are comparatively less costly than Nikon it wont create hole in ur pocket.I am not biased towards Nikon, i wrote wat i felt.Its not worth for money

Picture quality fantastic and camera handling and features are very good which will attract a beginner.

Let me explain.Yes, with 9 point AF with the OVF, you'll feel the AF a bit dated but does the job rather well. Live view has face detect but has a jerky continuous AF and is slow.But those are most of its negatives.The camera takes wonderful pictures and with digic 4+ image processor, the jpegs are perfectly usable. If you want perfection, shooting in RAW will give you what you need.The colors captured on this camera are perfect and natural, with settings to tweak them to your taste (see picture settings in menu).The build quality is solid and ergonomics of the camera, especially through its grip is wonderful. It feels perfect in my hands. The menu system is uncluttered and quite intuitive. It is very easy to customize the camera to your specific needs.You can shoot videos with this camera but without continuous AF, you'll get better results if you switch to manual focus during video.Why is it the best DSLR?Because of it's limitations in AF and simple straightforward usability it lets you take control over your photographs and videos unlike other advanced models which take control away from you and makes the choices for you. The result is you can get the exact photograph you intended to take. Combined with the 24 megapixel sensor, which is the same sensor found in almost all other canon APSC DSLRs, all the way upto 80D, the image quality is at par with much more expensive cameras.The digic 4+ processor is good for image processing, frankly the more advanced processors bring features such as 4K and such, which if you're not into video, you'll not miss it. The digic 4+ processor is more than adequate for your photography needs.With all the above considerations, it's the best DSLR you could get, in my opinion.

I have purchased this Canon DSLR after a small research. It's results were fantastic as a digital camera. But just after few months of purchase I found that sometimes it's shutter starts operating automatically without clicking any picture. Sometimes it worked ok but sometimes automatically opening and closing of shutter with annoying noice started. Then I contacted Canon serice centre. They gave me address of local service centre at Jabalpur MP. I gave them my camera for repairing. They sent it to Indore city workshop and it took nearly one and half month to return me. It was working ok at that time but after few days that shutter problem started again.Now I can not give this camera to workshop again and again so I am using this faulty camera as sometimes it works ok but sometimes it doesn't work due to shutter problem.I thought earlier that Canon was excellent brand but now my thinking is totally changed about it.

Ok the DSLR Giant Canon have launched 1 more entry level DSLR. Actually i bought this camera for my friend. Does this camera worth 31K. Lets seePROS1.  Its easy to use2. Decent battery backup3. Live mode operation is not lagging.CONS1. While focusing the DSLR is making too much noise and its the kind of annoying that u will lose interest in taking photos.2. No shortcut or assigned button to change F stop (aperture). A manufacturer who is keeping dedicated button for changing the ISO have to thing about the importance of aperture.3. You can't change the focusing point by pressing the round dial in the system, if u press it some other setup will open up.4. The output image quality is actually not mind blowing.5. White balance- Use it if u want to take risk6. Main issue. If u use camera flash to snap a pic during focusing it will flicker like anything and it will annoy and irritate the subject7. Noise Noise Noise. Whatever low ISO you use noise will b there and when i went to service center to ask about this they were saying use a prime lens to get good output.I am a Nikon user i have Nikon D3400. I compared both cameras by taking same images with same settings in manual mode. The output from Nikon is better than Canon 1500D.In one word if want to push photography to next level from using a Point and Shoot or mobile camera to DSLR Or to learn the whole DSLR setting go for it (only with a mindset to change the camera in 1 or 2 years). As canon accessories are comparatively less costly than Nikon it wont create hole in ur pocket.I am not biased towards Nikon, i wrote wat i felt.Its not worth for money

I have purchased this Canon DSLR after a small research. It's results were fantastic as a digital camera. But just after few months of purchase I found that sometimes it's shutter starts operating automatically without clicking any picture. Sometimes it worked ok but sometimes automatically opening and closing of shutter with annoying noice started. Then I contacted Canon serice centre. They gave me address of local service centre at Jabalpur MP. I gave them my camera for repairing. They sent it to Indore city workshop and it took nearly one and half month to return me. It was working ok at that time but after few days that shutter problem started again.Now I can not give this camera to workshop again and again so I am using this faulty camera as sometimes it works ok but sometimes it doesn't work due to shutter problem.I thought earlier that Canon was excellent brand but now my thinking is totally changed about it.

Over all does what it is suppose to be doing , built quality could have been better, as the magnets are just kept in places using basic stickers which loose it's place, the lights are prefect with the control option to dim and brighten the light as per requirement , foldio 360 is also good, but frankly I haven't yet tried it to the fullest , it's a great product photography studio , as Jewellery has the highest reflection and is difficult to shoot without a proper setup ,foldio does workUpdate: used foldio 360 it's a very simple app to connect and very easy to control the rotations , the entire setup is worth every penny spent

I bought this camera from local Canon dealer. Quality issue just in first month itself. Edit: Buy body only unless you need this travel lens.I bought the camera from a local canon store. Amazing performance with 18-135 combination. It is one of the best cameras anyone can buy without hesitation.Cons- 18-135mm performs far better on 80D than 90D ( Better shoot outdoors with enough light)- In low light Iso above 1600 is noisy with the 18-135 lens but the 80D got better image quality even at 2500 iso. 90D has more Megapixel but fails in low light when compared with 80D- Lacks ALL-I video processing- 120fps No Auto Focus & No stabilization
Great product the picture and video quality is pretty good it's an advance version of 80d damn great DSLR camera.

The auto focus system, both via the viewfinder and the live view is something which is unheard of in sub 1-1.5L canon cameras and even can beat Sony upto a6600 with accurate eye detection from farther away and even face detection detects faces farther away with similar focal length lenses on 90d and Sony a6400/6500/6600 and focuses faster provided you have a nano usm lens or atleast a usm or stm lens. But there aren't good f/2.8lens for ef-s with f/2.8 in all focal length ranges and ef lenses have a crop of 1.6 factor.Anyway the af works seamlessly in photos and videos. But the iso performance isn't that great of an upgrade compared to my older 60D, or even worst in some shots especially in high shutter speed, high iso in photos. But the af is spot on and ease of use is unbelievable.. U can change and see settings in multiple ways.. Using tough screen, using all the control wheels, using top small lcd screen, using q button  + joystick.. Want more?  Need to try out all of them in different scenario to make a decision on which is faster, but with initial experience, all are fast and its a hard decision.The ergonomics is always great and similar to my older 60D with some minute improvements. You won't be able to feel the weight reduction from 60/70/80D. For me, that's a good thing and have a solid feel.. Havn't tested the weather sealing capabilities. Hope I wouldn't have to torture it anytime soon. Though it boasts to withstands such tortures, I dont trust its ruggedness as much compared to a 7D mii.4K is nice, but indoor medium to low light and especially under LED and LED tube light, the flicker warning will be shown always and the noise levels aren't great even though the colours and focus is amazing. Noise levels in indoor lighting is worse than my poco f1 indoor videos. Stabilization is decent though not in same league as a gopro hero 8 black with hypersmooth, even with IS on.. I know it lacks IBIS, and no cannon has it ATM.Anyway simply the best crop sensor canon or any crop sensor cam. Really wished it has the 65 af points from 7D mii. Anyway the af speed is as good or even faster, and live view just obliterates the 7dmii af system. Really wish canon brings 65 af points though a firmware update.. But chances are less as the hardware system is different.Anyway a good investment.. Sad canon has announced to stop producing EF lens. Hope they restart since they just recently announced 1DX miii and do they want to kill it before its even officially realised?? Its believed to be the king of all Dslrs and mirrorless alike.Canon.. Please listen to our call and restart production of all EF lenses if you care.Edit:About the noise, I was wrong. Initially felt the noise in photos in higher iso is bit higher than older gens like 80/70D. But if you zoom in pixel-peep into the pics, you can see some type of correction has been performed in the noise, and it looks much less like nos and blends with the background color. That will have a good impact n prints or when viewed on large high res screens.Also I am loving its AF capabilities and faster bursts. I am not missing any moments and every shot is in focus, especially in Live view. The bundled 18-135 is magnificent in focusing speed and accuracy, compared to older 18-135 (which I own and planning to sell off now). Its dead silent and super fast AF in photos or video odes.

he Canon EOS 90D is a midrange DSLR that replaces the 3.5 year-old 80D and fits between the EOS 77D and the 'yes, it still exists' EOS 7D Mark II. It gains a new higher-resolution sensor with excellent Raw image quality, and offers competitive live view AF (with eye detect) as well as 4K video capture, all in a familiar package.The 90D is essentially the DSLR version of the mirrorless EOS M6 Mark II, which was introduced alongside it. Since the specs are nearly identical, it looks like Canon is letting potential buyers choose what type of shooting experience they want: a midsize DSLR with an optical viewfinder and more physical controls, or a smaller and lighter mirrorless model with a removable electronic finder. And, of course, the difference in native lens lineups between the EF and M mounts could attract different types of users, as well.Key features:32.5 Megapixel APS-C CMOS sensorDual Pixel autofocus (live view/video)45-point all cross-type AF (through the viewfinder)220k-pixel metering sensor w/face detection7 fps burst shooting w/continuous AFFully articulating 3" touchscreen displayOptical viewfinder w/100% coverage4K/30p video capture with no cropUSB 2.0 port with Micro USB connectorWi-Fi + BluetoothWhile the external design of the 90D doesn't dramatically depart from the pattern set down by the 80D, the guts of the new camera are quite a bit different, which we'll cover on the next page.

Thank you for letting me venture into the world of macro photography. Thi product is amazing, no wonder i can see so mamy photographers use it. It fits on lenses with filter size ranging from 52mm till 67mm, which covers almost all my lenses, especially on 85mm and 55-300mm thar i have is giving amazing reach. You can reduce min focal distance of all lenses considerably also the image is further zoomed in. So with 300mm i am able to get close as well as get an effevtive focal length of 300mm x 1.5 crop factor of my body x may be 2.5x zoom by Raynox, incredible. One thing I obserbed while using with 18-140 Nikon is that there is heavy vignetting but there is a trick to reduce it, take the focus to manual and get it to infinity, it will still focus close but you can move yourself back from the subject a bit to get it in focus but without the circular vignetting. Also there are significant colour fringing observable at highlighted area but that is ok, i am getting what i payed for. Autofocus works accurately even at low aparture no issues there, but macro is easier I guess focussing manyally and moving yourself to get intended focus. Overal am overjoyed with the purchase. Amazon packing and delivery is good, delivery has become even faster these days during Covid lockdown. Amazing guys  kudos to you all

This is a lens for super magnification of small n micro subjects, don't mistake it for macro lens or giving benefits of macro. U can use this as attachment in front of most of lenses and need to be very close to subject for getting good shots. And while it has certain technical difficulties especially in start, it's a good accessory for super macro user or high magnification picturesVignetting will almost always happen so just focus on good flash system for photography.

Its worth if you have patience and want a frugal alternative of MACRO lens...Frugal because its way less costly than a proper MACRO lens and You need patience because due to narrow DOF (at higher zoom) and moving subject, you have to take multiple shots to get satisfactory Image. Offcourse you will need a Tripod and an ample light source (in order to widen the DOF, we need to shorten the aperture size thus we need pretty good amount of light, but that holds true for a macro lens too)My Observation :I used this snap on Lens on my 50mm prime and 18-135mm all in one lens.With 50mm it worked well but didn't get much magnification so I used extension tubes.7mm extension tube + 50mm + Tripod + Good Light + static object =  nice resultsWith  18-135 mm, @135 I observed some vignetting as the lens thread is 67mm (wider than 50mm lens), I think It should work well with any P&S ultra zoom camera and any DSLR lens having 150+ focal length.Lens is good in the terms of use and optical quality, easy to clip on my 52 mm and 67 mm lenses.Pros-1. Easy to use2. Nice optical qualityCons-1. Vignetting at small focal length. Ideal for 150+ zoom lenses

I used this with 18-140 Nikkor lense. Picture quality is too good, but make sure you have enough lighting. I have external flash and that may be a requirement to get some goo details and sharpness. Also, you need to go more closer to get some shot, so if the subject is shy then you may not get shot easily. But with respect to the prize it is always worth keeping it.

Perfect Holster for DSLR with zoom lens. Using it for Canon 1200D with 55-250mm lens and Canon 6D with 24-105mm lens including hood. Enough pockets for charger,wire,cards etc. Build quality is excellent and very sturdy. Solid plastic base, quality inner with cushioning.

It appears it won't fit Nikon p1000, but in reality , the camera is cozy and comfortable inside, even with the additional 77mm uv glass inside the lens cap. OK for casual use. Small bag which can accommodate medium size DSLRs. The bottom portion is made out of some hard plastic material which is useful to protect the camera from hard hits against the surfaces on which the bag is kept casually.I had ordered for "yantralay Reversible 2 Side Neoprene Waterproof DSLR Camera Liner Case Cover Pouch For Canon, Nikon & Other Cameras" along with this. Keeping camera inside the pouch in this camera bag fits perfectly. Buying both of these items will be useful for various occasions.

Ordered this with doubt for my Nikon Coolpix P1000 (23CM x 15CM x 12CM) but somehow this fitted it correctly even with the hood attached, the quality looks better than Lowepro and has a lot of chains but the only problem is I canâ€™t keep my charger in it, pockets in it can only accomodate sleek items. If you are looking for the smallest bag for the huge Nikon P1000, it just fits it snugly, so the carry bag doesnâ€™t look big but if you are someone who wants a big bag to keep multiple lenses, chargers and other stuff, go for the Amazonbasics - Rectangular bag, this is meant for high zoom cameras with lens attached to camera.

I really loved this holster that got delivered in such a short span of time. I am using it for my Nikon D5100 that has an 18-55 lens. The base has got a  very nice density so you can place the lens in the downward position. The side walls are not very heavily cushioned though. You also have side pockets to store USB cable and battery charger. If you have got additional accessories or long lenses, then this holster is not for you.

This is a very good bag. Keeps my DSLR safe. This is what I was looking for. The bag is stiff enough from outside and quite soft from inside, unlike the EOS bag which I got with camera.Only drawback is, the bag cannot hold extra lense. Somehow, if slight increase in bag size to enable carrying one more lense could have won 6th star for this product. Pockets are small too, but my battery charger fits easily in that.Please buy it for your DSLR...

Great Quality Bag with super quality chain and fibers,multiple pockets also was very useful,dedicated pocket for SD cards are helpful.Fitted my D 5200 with 82mm dia lens fitted very comfortably with addition 82 mm polarized filter/lens cap/cleaning cloth/Remote Shutter with cord.Good for a day trip with battery full charge.Very much reliable for camera safety from water and bumps.Very well recommended in this budget, i got a flash deal of 999/- which was great for me.

I was very pleasantly surprised when I purchased this product. I love the hard bottom on this, not only does it provide safety and protection for the camera, but it allows you to just stand it up. The material is water-resistant from my experiences, Iâ€™ve had it on my shoulder in the rain and nothing got in. The inside of it is a lovely soft material, itâ€™s...

Amazing built quality. Chains are flawless. I've given one less star because I feel it could have been made a little more spacious to keep an extra lens or other accessories. The special slot for keeping memory card slot is amazing ! The adjustable paddings are very useful ! The stand below the cover is great since you can keep it standing in one place. Feels premium. Better than lovpro bags.

This product is perfect for 1200D with 18-55mm lens. The camera fits perfectly, without much gaps. Overall the quality of the product is good. Easily handled even during rain.

I bought this 3 months back and already traveled twice with it. I have a 77d body with 18-200 tamron and 10-18 Canon.I can carry this setup within this bag very easily.  Padding quality is good.
