When I was needing for a printer which suits me , then I went on searching for many blogs, articles and videos that which printer should I buy then I ordered this one .My requirements was - ( for a research student )1) Fast Printing ( Duplex- both sides)2) For longer use ( I don't use printer daily , that's why I neglected ink-based printers)3)Servicing and Brand ( Servicing means , cartridge is easily available and affordable and the printer have brand )So , I came with this one having all functions that I needed.Now , Pros -1) All above three2) Better printing quality3) Very easy to use , plug and play , can print 200 pages in one goCons -1) Not have led lights .2) I bought @13k , which I think is bit more ... Tldr: Printer is good, the software isn't great.Bought the printer for home use. It was very easy to install. The instruction manual was detailed and the instructions to download and install the drivers on Windows 10 were simple. Installs easily on MacOS also.Prints well, and is quite fast.The Interface to scan is not too great. It's easy if you want to scan a document into a pdf, but images are a bit complicated. It was easier on my old Canon Deskjet.Copy function doesn't work great with IDs. The photos usually end up with high contrast and black out at times. One workaround is to scan and then print.Overall, the printer is good if using primarily to print/scan documents.

This is my first Brother made printer, found complete satisfaction, print quality is clean, sharp. Design is so nice. So many features available. I like duplex printing feature. software is also easy and user friendly. Scanning is just perfect. Speed of scanner and printer is fast as they mentioned. overall good deal.

worthless printer and seller distributed wrong information on amazon portal about wireless connection and product other features related.Please amazon check all details regarding products .i am not happy purchase this printer its just like a black marketing

Very good product and fast delivery by Amazon and very good paking . product is too good than comparison. And lot's of options available in brother printer...thank you Amazon and thank you brother

Excellent printer. Does the job. Consistent print quality and fairly easy to use. The parts feel made with fragile plastic but for the price I dont think I should complain.The only problem is the LCD display. Itâ€™s very hard to read the display and this is a real shame as this is the only â€œuser interfaceâ€ and I believe Brother should introduce a backlit display or something similar.The other disadvantage is that the software that comes with this printer (also available for download from the internet), is heavy and tends to make your computer very slow.

If you require an easy to use, office like print operation and quality at affordable price, look no further, this is the printer for you. The installation was hasslefree, you can download drivers from the link provided in the manual and within 30 minutes the printer is installed. The cartridge drum has a orange locator and the manual has markings and depictions to help you place the toner cartridge in the cartridge drum. The entire process of setting up the printer was a smooth experience. Press the start button, press the print on the PC and the printer starts in a jiffy, the speed of printing is lightning fast and the two sided print happens automatically and seamlessly. Overall, the print quality and the print operation and installation is superb and plug and play. Have to test the scanner though. This is a very capable printer for a home office and can print in bulk and fast. Go for it.

Setup is a breeze thanks to the included CD. If a CD/DVD drive is not available, then the drivers have to be downloaded from the Brother Support Website. The size is around 200MB.TIP: When choosing the printer model to download the drivers from their website, choose Asian Region and then select Indian Specific Models and you will find the drivers there.

Overall a good printer.  I had some initial set up issues.  Could not control the contrast and the darkness of the prints. I am quite satisfied with this printer now.  I do not know the support available for this printer in India, but let us hope that I do not need one. :-)
Excellent printer for both home and office use. Crystal clear prints till now.very good printing speed.Overall highly recommended.

The print quality is great and it's quite fast too. Automatically prints both sides of the paper. Scanner and copier functions work fine. I had no trouble with installation. I'm quite surprised at the connectivity options though (the lack of them to be precise). It only has a USB port. And that's it. Not even an Ethernet port. If it had Wireless connectivity, it would have been ideal for me. But it doesn't. It's pretty expensive for what it has to offer, but it does print very well. I've had big problems with inkjet printers, and I've learnt that ink tank printers have problems with printer heads becoming bad in a year or so. So, laser was the only option for me. I don't print very often and I don't want to keep changing the cartridge  every time I want to use it. I hope it lasts a while - it looks quite sturdy.

Upgraded from my old HP deskjet with HP 415 All-in-One Tank Wireless Color Printer.The experience so far has been good. Received the printer in good condition with proper packing.The setup process is easy using the manual. As move forward in the setup process, the test pages give you further steps on how to proceed. I liked this approach.I was able to get my laptop, 2 mobiles setup for printing wirelessly in 15-20 min (including downloading of the app and software)The spill proof tech for ink filling is impressive.Print quality is good. The printing over wireless appears to take small delay if you are not using Wi-Fi direct and instead going through the router.I did not check photo printing as yet but should be good for home printing.

The printer came in a nice packaging the delivery was fast and the printer box was all new not opened. The setup was pretty easy if you just follow the instructions given in manual which is provided in the box. The best thing i like about this printer is the print quality, easy to refill ink and the wireless connectivity feature by which you can use your phone to print the photos or files. The printer has both Wi-Fi Direct and simple Wi-Fi network by which you can connect to the printer and you have to download 2 apps which is already there in the play store or the app store.

I got this printer and wanted to connect my phone to it. I am told that it won't work on an IOS and neither a MAC because it aint compatible. Tech support people should know that wifi printing doesn't really use drivers and its just configuration. At the time of calling I was already able to print through my MAC. While connecting through my phone it was asking for the printers network key. I was told to call HP for the same. The truth is that to get the network key just print the network config from the printers menu - simple. Also while listing out product information do mention the GHz band in which the printer will work - its 2.6Ghz only and not 5Gz as modern day broadband networks are. Or if you have a dual band router. A customer who is not technically sound will either return your product or will give a bad customer satisfaction score as I am doing.

Pros :-*Wifi printing is effective*HP Warranty is covered (provided you have registered the product )*HP installation is applicable*Anywhere printing through HP smart app or email*Printer quality is good*Works with Alexa seamlessly* Touch screen pad is smooth* extended warranty is recommendedCons :-*Automatic duplex printing  is not available this is the biggest drawback with such an expensive printer .*Little Noisy* printing tray doesnâ€™t hold printouts effectively . I received brand new seal packed product. Initially while setup, I added ink and then when I have to install cartridges and print the alignment page,  then i saw the holder where we have to fit the cartridges it was hitting the printer left and right very hard and not stopping in the middle. I called HP support and they tried to solve the issue over phone with sew trouble shooting steps. However result was same. HP arranged the service call for me and I also talked to amazon support for the issue. I explained them that I got faulty product which I can to know after inserted the ink so  I was hesitated to return the product as this might be given to someone else. But Amazon says, this is not my (ME) issue and will be taken care by Amazon even product is opened and they arranged the return and refund as same product was not available anymore with them.5 star for AMAZON.Both HP and Amazon was scheduled for next day. Luckily HP guy came firs and fixed the issue in 2 minute by unscrewing 4 screw and placed the transparent encoded strip in position (sensor behind cartage holder). He said this might happened in transport. Once it worked, i canceled the return request.5 star for HP support.Printer:Black ink is pigment and hence once printed on paper it is waterproof even if you put the printed paper in the bucket full of water.Color is not waterproof, however they don't fade easily.ADF: This is the plus advantage in this printer over HP 515. Just keep the bundle of paper in ADF and get the scanned or copy without any mess.INK: I got 3 color (GT 52 70 ml), Magenta, Cyan, Yellow each and 3 black (GT 52 XL 135 ml) you will get only 1 black in HP 515 which is 2000 cheaperOverall printer is good.5 star for Printer.

I initially purchased this printer for basic home use as well as to print PCB designs, However this printer jams on transparencies and 200GSM paper 90% of the time even after selecting 200GSM in printer settings, didn't expect this from HP as it says in the manual this printer can print on OHP transparencies the print quality isn't great on transparencies when it happens to not jam. also the vertical scaling on this printer is unreliable and it causes an issue for large PCB designs as sometimes it prints the PCB 1-3mm longer vertically (the same pdf prints different sizes vertically so it is 100% a printer issue), however horizontal size is spot onpros: the black is really jet black and it prints very fast, i can print a 10 page 2 sided document in less than 40 secondscons: the printer mostly jams easily on some types of paper, it cannot print properly on transparencies and the HP mobile app doesn't allow you to change the size of of the print when printing from a phone so a small picture takes the full a4 paperi also own a canon E500 inkjet printer and i cannot remember the last time any type of paper jammed in the canon, however this HP printer jams on thick or glossy papers extremely easily.

I bought two of these. Wanted a simple laser printer that had wifi connectivity. Setup was easy, print quality is good. It takes very less space on desk due to its compact design. Make sure that the first setup is done by connecting it to the computer else it ends up configuring it's wireless profile and it takes a setting reset to reconfigure and add it to the network. If you are confused between inkjets and laser, think about how many color prints you need and take a call. If you are going to just print blacks usually. This one is the best option.
Buy it only if you do not want support from HP. As it says this product is no longer serviced by HP on the official support website.

The print quality from this printer is spotty. Characters in printed text don't have sharp edges. It feels like someone's chiseled off the ink. The printer arbitrarily applies its own margins especially on non standard paper sizes. This has often driven me crazy. When two copies of the same document are printed, the two have different margins.The Windows driver doesn't work. The only way I can operate the scanner is my Android phone. The scanner feed mutilates the originals at the edges, and the scanned documents are usually a little tilted, even though the guides are made to snugly sit along the paper edges.Overall, a mediocre product.

This is an excellent printer that prints on both sides of the page which was my main requirement. The front led panel is also excellent and I could assign the wireless ssid, password and ip address to it easily using the buttons on the printer. Printing and scanning to this wirelessly is a breeze. The only negative I see is that when I am using A4 size paper and the person sending me the document has incorrectly selected page size letter, then this printer gives an error printing on the back of the page. So before printing on two sides I need to manually go and check the paper size and change it to A4. I have not had paper jams but I have seen youtube videos which say that you have to remove screws behind the printer to remove the jammed paper. In my older hp I just had to pull out the cartridge and remove the jammed paper. Overall I am very happy with this printer, I would highly recommend it. It is a bit on the heavy side though as compared to my older HP multifunction printer.

In a day and age where colour printers are very cheap, I went for a laser printer for my WFH purposes. The printer came as promised, in a double packaging. I opened it and set it up. It worked using the USB without any problems but I did find the wifi option not easy to set up. Followed the instructions in the manual, still no luck. Finally, I called Canon and the person came the same day. He took 5 minutes to set it up and it is working fine. It is a joy to be able to print without attaching cables. Four of us work from home therefore this is a great option and additionally, I can print from my mobile also. However, it takes two apps to do it. That is a total pain. Plus if Canon can make the wifi setup manageable by non IT persons, then it would be amazing.

Purchased from Appario Business.History - On the onset let me tell you all, this is my second Canon Printer. Previously used Canon LBP2900B and Canon Lide 100 scanner. This combination used for around 10 years and the scanner conked. The printer still works.Requirements - Wanted a multi functional setup with Dual side printing, auto document feed, photo copy  and LAN & / WiFi. Looking into many other companies like HP, Epson, Brother finally decided to go with Canon. Previous experience got the brand loyalty of me.Overall - The printer has USB, LAN and WiFi connections for printing and scanning. There is a graphic LCD display on the front side panel which can be tilted upwards for better visibility. It has fair number of key(s) with specific and general functionality. It can do photo copying also. This feature is really quick and good. Top side is the flat bed scanner and document feeder. Two trays for paper at the bottom. It can also directly print from mobile phones. A lot of network related features.Printer - Good print quality with dual side print and various other paper saving print programs. Booklet, envelope printing and other document functionality also present, not tested them yet. The print software in Windows has all the control features.Scanner - The flat bed scanner has good resolution and also there is some software enhancement for the scanner.It gives good results. ADF system feeds the documents one by one, it is good to scan multiple pages in a stack.It can scan ID card both faces on to the same page.Connectivity - USB, LAN, WiFi. Connect your laptop through USB, LAN or WiFi. Print/Scan directly from mobile phones without laptop.Windows - All features of the printer can be used in Windows 10 with the provided software.Linux (Ubuntu 18.04) - Printing and Scanning possible with a little effort. Not all features tried.Android - Printing and Scanning possible with a little effort. Not all features tried. Canon Print Service app, Mopria Print, Mopria Scan required.Mac - not testediPhone - not testedThe device comes with a power cable, USB cable, software CD, toner cartridge and user manuals.Note: The software in the CD is a bit old, it does not work on Win 10, need to download the latest from website.The best features -Dual side printing, it saves time and paper.ID card both faces scanned on the same page. ADF for scanning.Photocopy without PC/laptopMobile phone direct print and scan feature, save a lot of time, no PC/laptop required.The hurdles -Software for Windows on the CD is old, need to download from website.Configuring the LAN and WiFi is a bit tricky.All features are not available / tricky for Linux.Scope for improvement -Better feature support and Control Applications for Linux.

It worked fine for around 2 months. After it has printed around 500 pages, the toner level showed half and the prints started coming out very faded. I thought perhaps we should refill the toner. So I bought the genuine toner refill from HP website  and refilled the toner. Instantly the ink level showed 100%. But the print quality remained the same.I called HP support and after 45 minutes of call, the engineer said that the print head seems to be a problem and an engineer will visit me.I waited for 8 days, no one showed up. I called HP support again, they said contact TVS Electronics in Jayanagar, Bangalore. I tried calling them at least 200 times.. on various of their phone numbers listed on HP website and google. No use.I called HP support again and was told they cannot do anything if the service centre is not responding.The hilarious part is that HP sent me survey link for the service request which was never solved. I wrote back asking them to look into the callousness of their service centre. But no action from HP again!I wasted 20K on this printer, just because I trusted the HP brand. Received the printer in perfect condition. It works as expected, no complaints. This is SCARY !Advisory to Ricoh customers for Online purchases of SP 111 PrintersNew Delhi, 30 September 2014: Ricoh India Limited would like to issue an advisory cautioning its current and potential consumers of Ricoh SP 111 series laser printer and A4 MFP.Ricoh India has not authorized sales of SP 111 and SP 111SU models on any e-commerce companies website such as Flipkart, Snapdeal, Amazon, Infibeam and Shopclues, or any resellers through market place on the above e-commerce sites. Any such sales is considered as unauthorized and illegal in the nature. Ricoh would void the warranty for such sales/purchases.Ricoh India does not guarantee the authenticity of this models purchased from such e-commerce sites in terms of its quality, specifications, price and performance. We would like to encourage our customers to check the partner authorization and warranty entitlements while purchasing online.For any online purchases of Ricoh Printers/s, services and its consumables, we recommend you to visit our Ricoh India e-commerce store.

Print quality: Works flawlessly and has very good print quality.Print speed: Duplex print speed is a bit slow - but acceptable.Size: The printer is quite compact for a duplex printer.Installation: Printer installation was smooth on linux (though so far we have not managed to get the scanner to work on linux - its been working fine on Windows).Scanner: So far - we have encountered slight smudges when scanning at high resolution. Not sure if its due to the surface needing cleaning or driver issue or a fundamental issue with scan quality in this model.Price: The auto-duplex feature at this price range in color ink-tank printer is so far (beginning of 2021) only available in Canon. Hence its a good value for money (but still significantly more expensive than non-duplex ink-tank printers)Other Notes: We bought this from a local vendor (as we read many negative reports of damaged printer/scanners purchased online on this website).

A distribution sales office where I previously worked was my first hands on experience with Dot Matrix printers.Having used only inkjet & Lazerjet printers all my school and college life which gave fast & clear prints, a slow dot matrix printer was like a vintage car to me.But after having printed my first sales bill which required 3 copies per bill (Original, Duplicate for transporter & triplicate for accounts) it struck me that commercial printing on a daily basis is a massive cost and only dot matrix printers can minimize the hole in your pocket.So when i started my trading business the first thing i bought was the Epson LX-310.Epson is a reliable brand in the printing industry so i gave this no second thought.The printer works like a charm and can also print on 4 sided paper if required.Print speed is decent.. I use a three sided paper which has carbons in the middle and it takes about 20 seconds for a full GST Invoice print from Tally.Setup.. Heres where this is tricky as I am using 3 sided paper the initial lining up of the paper has to be precise to avoid wastage and ensue accurate prints. Invest the little extra time to understand the setup process to ensure peaceof mind and low costs in the future.Maintenence.. I have been using the printer for over two years now and it has never electrically faulted. The only thing you have to do is keep changing the ribbon in the printer when your prints appear less dark. I simply have a tie up with my local stationary man who replaces it for me when ever needed on a cost effective contract basis.In conclusion it is a great product which should be purchased by individuals or firms who need over 30-40 prints on a daily basis. The. Long term cost efficiency of this slightly expensive machine is what dot matrix is all about.IF YOU FOUND THIS REVIEW USEFUL, PLEASE HIT THE HELPFUL BUTTON UNDER THIS REVIEW.Happy Printing..- Gills Guide.

Please don't buy this model.I already use epson M200 and was very happy with the performance of that product.The official website claims performance of 4500 pages for B/W and 7500 coloured pages per refill. But the performance of 25 normal official letters has lead to consumption of 1/3rd of black ink. The epson engineer said that the performance usually is 1000 pages max. This is furiating. The company should be penalised for making such false claims.I am still using Epson M200 and am satisfied with it, but this model should have never existed.

The product is a waste of money rather my suggestion to go for Epson lesser price ink tank product. My product was faulty with no proper quality testing. The resolution was poor. Might be the head was malfunctioning. Blame has to be taken by EpsonCouple of noticeable issues1. The Control panel dash board is useless, not at all user friendly2. When my paper got jammed the panel was obstructing to take out the paper3. The width of paper feeder support is less hence the A4 size paper tends get backward swing.

Go for the next model in L series of printer if you've made your mind to buying this only. Automatic Document Feeder isn't of worth use in this model. Also, you'll miss automatic double side printing technology if you buy this product.
I think, all the printer companies from Hp to Epson, using 6000-7500 pages advertising as a publicity stunt.If you really want to purchase any printer, 600-750 pages are usable. Maybe less!

A good compact all in one printer. Connecting to a computer or a smart phone is extremely easy.Advantages: Can scan/print large sized papers like legal, etc.  ADF makes life easy while scanning but two sided scans make arranging the pdf files a tedious activity.  Print quality is excellent and ink refills are very convenient and cost effective.Against: Build quality leaves a lot to be desired. Plastic quality could have been a lot better. No input paper tray makes life difficult as everytime you have to put paper manually and store it separately.Overall a very good all in one for home use or for a small office.

Just go for it. This one falls in the sweet spot where it not vry expensive and provides everything that you need and nay be more. Print quality is superb. Wifi enabled and air printing (using apple products) really rock. Has a compact design and easily movable. Adf for scan/copy is another cool feature. Inks too last long and easily fillable. Can connect fast to multiple devices using Epson iprint app and also use it via email from any where in the world. Overall, this one is the most complete printer for home/office 100 pgs a day or may be more.

This is probably the most underrated black and white printer in the market.It is single function Monochrome Inktank PrinterOften we Buy Multifunction printers even though we use other features like scanning rarely> so instead of buying substandard multi-functional at this price range> go for PERFECTIONIST Single function printerThis is designed for a single function which it does with full dedicationI am a student and needs only black and white prints so it's perfectOperation is easy and totally Noob Proof so anyone will understand properlyLet's Come to print OpsIt has three modes> Draft<Standard<Highand trust me you will never need High modeEven Lowest mode DRAFT is good for reading> though someone will not like it> Standard mode is too good even for official purpose dark printingBesides, it has 3 years/50000 pages ON-SITE WARRANTYAnd Large 140 ml Ink bottle costs only 600 INRI will update how many pages did 70mL ink lastedFirst Photo is of printerSECOND AND THIRD PHOTO> PRINTING IN STANDARD MODEFOURTH AND FIFTH PHOTO DRAFT MODEI Never used HIGH mode because I never felt the need for itEDIT 1> after 1 yearAs you can see I have 3672 pages in one big bottle ( And I still have Ink left for about 400 text intensive pages)YOU WILL NEVER GET PAGES PROMISED BECAUSE INDUSTRY STANDARD FOR ALL PRINTERS (INCLUDING THIS ONE) is based on 5% coverage of page> Estimated yield of 6000 pages means that when your page is only 5% filled (See sample attached ) which is never going to be possible in real life> So for full page printing I got quite good deal.FACT 2> i used MS word for documents> If you have file in MS word use the settings which I use>> Make default FONT CALIBRI> It is thin , Proffesional > hence takes less ink> search on google for less intensive fontsFACT 3 > if you have document on word > select all and lessen the darkness of text > like I have shown in image 50% lighter and still it will give you awesome light prints (lesser than STANDARD, MUCH BETTER THAN DRAFT MODE)> SAVES Ink as wellThank YOUEDI

Epson Seiko is a Japanese company known for their excellent quality. I used to have HP printers earlier but found these are not good. I switched over to Epson printers recently. I have two Epson printers. One is L-4150 Ink Tank Colour Printer and another is M-1100 printer which is a black and white printer. The print quality of both of them is superb and cost of one print is very low. I have been using both the printers for some time and have not found any problem. The After Sales Service of Epson is good. I strongly recommend if one wants to buy ink tank printers, then go for Epson. I have iMac which has no CD drive. I just downloaded drivers for M-1100 from the Epson web site and immediately started using the printer. It is noise less and has no frills. Cost is very affordable. But it can handle only A-4 size paper. Epson sends their service engineer if you want his service for installation. It is a free service.

I bought this Canon printer few months back . After few months of its usage , I have following feedback to provide1. Print quality is very good . Very legible and dark printing2. Print speed : I will not say it is fast , but it is neither slow too . If you are a medium user , it can work fine for you3. Now the best part : Wifi connectivity : At this price range , you will rarely find any branded Wi fi enabled printer . Wifi is really good and works efficiently . Only downside is you need to change the setting every time , if you want to change the wifi source . Mobile Wifi is also noteworthy4. Support : Right now I have not experienced any problem with this printer and so can't tell about after sales support , but they charged me for installing the printer , which should be free for better experienceOverall , a good buy and worth of money . Will update later in case of any new observations

Having used the earlier non WiFi version of this printer it was a no-brainer to opt for this upgrade. The earlier one was very much functional when I gave it away.As for the printer, the wifi setup was a breeze after downloading the app. And barring occasional glitches when the printer decides to keep the paper in its womb, the printer has been giving good prints no matter what the quality or colour of the paper.Totally satisfied with the product.

All in all a decent affordable printer that does what is expected of a home printer. Setting up Wireless printing on laptop (win 10) as well as android phones is pretty simple. Plenty of  YouTube videos explain these. Not a direct WiFi printer, you require to connect via a wireless router. Once set, the unit retains WiFi settings even after restarting the printer.Print quality is good, supplied toner is genuine 925 toner cartridge. There are compatible cartridges online below 600 rupees which is a big plus (yet to try).With a reputed brand Canon can't go wrong.Product received made in Vietnam.Few cons noted:1) Unlike brother model this printer doesn't have a dedicated paper tray. Dust collects on paper if kept uncovered.2) No duplex printing. You have to manually turn and place paper in tray. For regular use it's a great feature.3) WiFi direct printing would be beneficial.

Followed the instructions to install but got stuck as the app was trying to connect to a download site not approved by microsoft. Had to call tech support to complete installation. It seemed to be a trial and error operation , spent 49 minutes on call . some parts of the installation process seemed to go on in an endless loop. The support person was very patient and polite during the process. Understand there may be limitations due to work from home , hence this is not a complaint , just an observation. Perhaps the manufacturer should consider upgrading the tools provided to their support staff in view of the lock down scenario.

Absolutely worst printerCannot print duplex printTrust me do not buy this printer will only increase your work moreImpossible to print 2 sided from this printer even by printing odd pages first and then even pages after thatCannot print manual duplexPay more money and buy a decent good quality printerTotal waste of money and waste of pages as it is not possible to print two sided correctly from this printer

1) White colour product is supplied to me instead of black printer.2) When contacted Canon services department for wifi installation , they demanded installation charges. ( But Amazon customer care said "installation is free*)3) Wifi is there but they said "modem is required".

As canon is canon but still I think this model should be little modified by manufacture for two things . 1) This printer should have dust cover on paper loading tray at bottom like (Hp1020) as paper bunch remains open in this model & dust appears on top of paper.2) Top paper holding tray should modified like Hp1020. As my desktop table has already undertable provision for printer space but due to this printer top paper holder tray which consumes more height , it stucked while entering to its place , so I dismental that tray from printer & inserted but now my printer is without paper holder tray.( If kept this printer on open table top then it's ok.) Otherwise verry nice quality printer in everything (hardware , print quality & its budget price)

This printer has 2 main advantages - number of prints per minute(18-checked works well) & number of prints per catridge(1500-1600 promised- yet to verify that number).Print quality is excellent. One may have to get in touch with Canon support in case installation by USB is needed. Other wise it connects seamlessly with Wifi router used for internet in the house using WPS option and it makes life a lot easier.It lacks both side printing but one can use adobe pdf reader and print odd even pages and it does the trick. The stated pages ler catridge was 1600, however my personal experience says it only orints about 50% of that number i.e. 800 pages. after that the print quality fades. spare catridge costs 2.5k (original).No colour printing so one must be aware of this while buying this printer.Would not recommend this.

This is the first printer which i bought by doing lot of online research and it turned to be best because it had, the features which i wanted the most i.e. Wi-Fi connectivity at economical cost. I bought this for INR 8,950 which gives 1100-1200 pages (company claim) and the quality of the print is excellent. The only thing which i request the canon company to incorporate is duplex printing in this model and improved version of manual. I am advising an improved version of manual because it took 5hrs to connect to laptop and Wi-Fi connectivity after going through lot of online videos because existing manual was very little help that's the reason i gave 4 stars too easy to use.One more important thing they distributor even provided GST bill which i could reimburse.

I had kept an eye on this product since 2017, at that time I had no money to invest in the laser printer so I waited but the cost of the product rose so high that I regretted to my earlier decision of not buying this product at that time, apart from the cost of the product the printer is good looking and Wi-Fi printing works perfectly, I have not printed more than 20 pages at a time. It declutters the space by implementing Wi-Fi connectivity.

Doesn't look original, looks like from gray market.The instruction manual looks printed locally.There was no packing , printer was simply put in the box , scratch and finger prints.It was looking like some has returned it . Don't buy from this seller.

This is my 10 month usage review and after 7000+ printoutsPros- Clean and crisp printouts.- Wireless printouts are as fast as wired ones.- easy to install wirelessly as well wired- Easy to delete pending printouts- Detects changes in types of pages (if it's a stamp paper of A4 or ledger paper) and prompts before printing.Cons- Drivers sometimes fail to load but this is rare. I have to reboot the computer for it to work properly.- sometimes on cold mornings it draws in multiple pages into the printer. However no pages get stuck and printout is not affected.I have not faced any serious issues and I am using this printer in very dusty environment.

It is easy to install and use. But if you are planning to take prints of colour images,don't buy this printer as it will not print the coloured areas of the images. A decent printer. Print density is a bit on the lighter side but will do the job for day to day use. No WiFi direct, router is needed to print wirelessly. Simple printer by canon. price is only for brand. After use I can say good printer, print is ok but first toner cartiridge  come with printer, give only 300-350 pages. After it print become light. I could not understand why print become light.

Canon LBP6030w 2 month user feedback - The product in this price range is amazing. The printing quality is superb & range of the Wifi is great. Excellent product. Changing over from deskjet to laser because of economy and the headache of ink running dry (very infrequent use). Excellent value for money. Also delivery was very fast.
This is a great little laser printer. You have to go online to find the setup though your router but once I found a video explaining, it was easy. It has three buttons only which operation very easy.

The printer arrived on time and the packaging was good. As regards the printer it is quite good. good quality of prints. very easy to install.For Wifi, it is not straightforward as it supports only WPS network for Wifi. received the package in very good condition like a showroom one. Its very fast in printing aswell. I do recommend this product over hp

Affordable printer and its look is very good and best thing in this printer it is affordable and durable woth for every single penny.

My horrible luck. I was busy ever since I purchased this printer and now today ( 2 weeks after delivery) when I turned on the printer for the first time, it exploded! YES it exploded!!!!  My room smella of burned capacitors.But when I switched it over to 230 v on the PSU ( it was stuck on 115v) the printer worked like a charm. I would like to explain how good the customer service was. I spoke to Sagar from the Banglore office and Suprim from the technical team. I was amazed by how helpful they were. Luckily all seems good and the prints are fine for now. But I'm happy with knowing these guys have such a great service team behind them.Loose one star for not including clear instructions on which setting to use SPECIALLY WHEN THE THING WILL EXPLODE IF ITS ON WRONG SWITCH.LOOK AT MY PUPPY!!

The benchy printed is out of the box with 0.2 mm layer height. This printer is just awesome! Took me around an hour to assemble using a YouTube tutorial as the provided leaflet was slightly confusing. Had one spring missing though. But got it delivered within a day of reporting to Wol 3d. Awesome support. Keep it up guys!

The print quality and performance are quite are satisfactory given the quality of components encountered while unpacking.4 stars for the performance and reliability of the printer for a week so far.2 stars for quality of the components - the 2040 rails and the aluminium printer bed were dinged with scratches and lacerations. Either poor quality control - or we are getting the returned/repackaged products from other markets.The printing surface is hard to level as it is not possible to rigidly secure it to the heated bed. Also there is a slight depression at the center so leveling the four corners doesn't imply good adhesion on at the center. I believe this is going to trouble me on larger prints - where only part of the first few layers will stick to the bed. I hope to come up with some solution for this.The usual Ender 3 related design issues do exist but we were already aware of them before the purchase.

This product is underrated by many. With proper knowledge of product assembly and slicing it works like a pro.I work primarily on PLA and ABS - results are 10 stars. My clients are happy.Prints wood to perfection...More than value for money.Product support from WOL is awesome - make sure you buy ONLY from them.

Excellent packaging, loads of foam and bubble wrap. Assembly instructions were a bit confusing at first, but a after a few YouTube videos it made sense. my unit came with a black silicone sock for the hot end and a removable build plate (non magnetic). the bowden tube couplers were also good quality and be sure to put the blue clips on the coupler Also i found out that the bowden tube on the side of the hot end was not cut properly, good thing i noticed that before turning the printer on. i would strongly suggest taking the tube out and check if both ends are cut properly otherwise you'd have your hot end leak filament in the wrong direction.now to the printer itself, its just and ordinary ender 3 which means there is a lot tuning and careful assembly required but once you are done with all that expect the print quality to be flawless, at this price point this is by far the best printer you could buy with your money as of this date.Also i got a card from the seller trying to woo me into giving the printer a 5 star review by offering 100 rs on paytm.and i would have given this printer a 5 star rating regardless, but its gonna get a 4 star one cause of the seller trying to do this.To the seller- IF i can afford a 17000 machine then i would seriously not care bout 100rs. use your common sense, plus reviews are not meant for sale. if you're trying to do this that makes you a bad seller.

This is a good printer. Assembly took 1-2 hours. To get it working you would need to adjust the bed level and extruder filament. There are plenty of tutorial videos available on Youtube to get it started. You would need to make sure the bed level is fine each time you start printing with this. Print quality is good. Recommended for people who are looking for the first 3d Printer.

The printer is good. It took sometime to set it up. I printed the pig.gcode that was provided in the sd card.Regd installation we need to go by the manual as well as online videos.We need to be careful with the pin switch that is attached with the motor when assembling (not to break it).The printer function is accurate, It took approx 8hrs (patience required) to complete the pig 3d printing.Test filament (white) is provided, we need to insert the filament via the clip on the motor and through the white tube (while starting for the first time) else it might get stuck. Extra filament you need to order. Test filament was not enough for this task.All round i like the 3d printer, now need to see what are the different models we can create, just started:)

My frist printer.Assembly was easy but the screws are not properly labelled and it took some time to figure out.It says the upgraed one has some yellow strips but mine doesn't have any. Not sure if it is the regular one or the "yellow strip" identification is true.

The seller is the authorised distributor for Creality 3D printers in India. They were prompt and cordial in responding to my queries.A no-frills experience that took less than an hour to set it up. Started printing right away. Good is you're just starting into 3D printing and dependable if you make money out of it.The bottom part of the machine comes assembled in the box. Easy to assemble the remaining parts with the help of provided manual, tools and Youtube Videos.The provided magnetic build-plate is textured, so parts stick very well without any tapes or adhesives.  But it's a tad bigger than the build platform, so care must be taken to place it properly on the platform so as to not rub against the vertical extrusions or the power supply.The extruder and hot-end cables must be properly tied with the provided zip ties as they can go behind the build plate and prevent it from travelling fully to the back of the printer.There is a channel on the underside of the machine from which the cables are given out from the control board. As it's sharp, a cable protector part must be downloaded and printed from Thingiverse.The firmware must be upgraded to the latest Marlin for better safety and print quality. First, the Arduino bootloader needs to be flashed to the Creality 1.1.4 controller board which is based on Melzi controller. It is compatible with the Sanguino board having Atmel ATmega1284P. A USBasp programmer with 10 pin FRC to 6 Pin ICSP connector is needed. Then compile and flash latest Marlin firmware (currently v2.0.4.4 when reviewing). Refer online guides for flashing the bootloader and firmware.Other upgrades that can be done are:1. Bullseye fan duct - better bridging.2. Extruder knob - easy filament loading and unloading.3. Glass build plate - smooth PLA first layer.4. OctoPrint on a Raspberry Pi with printed cover.5. Logitech C170 webcam for time-lapse with printed mount - webcam view in photos.Recommended filaments are WOL3D, e-Sun and Rever Fibreel. The provided filament in the box is very less. So buy a spool when you buy the printer to get started right away.

If you are looking for budget 3d printer with decent prints, look no further, this one is best as entry level printer as well as intermediate work.I bought it from wol3d and it was brand new and well packed. If you have no knowledge of assembling 3d printer (just like me), they provide you with SD card with reader, open it in PC and watch unboxing video, it will rapidly orient you. Or you can follow pictorial manual provided to assemble the printer.Once it's done you need to level the base as this is not self balancing one.  Simple method of passing paper below nozzle where it passes with mild resistance works fine. I used chep's gcode (from his YouTube video) to balance the base and test it. I got decent print but base is little wobbly so I need to find workaround for that.I use ultimaker cura as slicing software as its free, easy and has lot of useful features.Now a few upgrade you might like to consider...1) Power supply is upgradable and you will need it if you want to upgrade your machine later. (I haven't upgraded anything  yet)2) Main board does not support many features such as auto leveling upgrade.  So go for skr mini e3 main board which has many support features (including support for duel extruders).  But beware it will need flashing of recent firmware and it's not as simple as it sounds.3) obviously auto leveler4) print smoothers5) glass base or carbon fiber sheet base.The list can go on and on but just have fun with 3d printing and experimenting with this affordable 3d printer.I have included a photo of skull insignia which was my first print, my son got excited and colored it. Later I stuck magnet behind it and now it's in use.Thank you for reading my review, I hope you find it useful.

Well i wasted my first 1kg of filament printing stupid things, but if you find a good use it can be amazing.Got bad tolerances first few time while printing (needed some calibration) but works as good as it can get for the price limit.

I received a well packaged shipment from Wol3D and was fairly easy to assemble once you lay out the components as mentioned in the instructions. It took more time to tune the fittings rather than just assembling it eg. the X/Y axis rollers were quite tight. I ended up loosening them a bit to reduce strain on the wheels.Pros:* Good quality prints once bed leveling is done* The provided build plate(had a Wol3D logo printed) has good adhesion, atleast for PLA filaments I had tested* Ships with Creality 1.1.4 board with Marlin 1.1.6.2 firmware. I downloaded source code from Creality's website and it seems thermal runwaway protection is enabled but did not test it out to verify.* The prints were fairly silent and I could only hear only the fans and buzzer being more louder. Not sure if it has TMC2208 drivers but probably my prints also didn't have high acceleration movements. Sounds levels of the steppers are absolutely okay for me* The package included yellow rubbery strips that go into the V slots as shown in the picture. More than just improving the look, I placed them strategically to prevent dust buildup on the horizontal bars, wherever possible. I guess it may help to dampen vibrations as well* Unlike reports, the Z axis rod seems to be aligned correctly for me. Seems Creality has fixed this issue* Includes a fair amount of filament for test prints* Has rubber feet to dampen vibrations* Absolute VFM compared to other printers in the rangeCons:* Creality board is 8bit, hence reducing your capabilities in terms of enabling more features or adding attachments* Ships with an outdated firmware and no bootloader installed. Latest Marlin is 2.0.x as of the day of writingSo far buying experience from Wol3D has been good. I hope they step up their game in providing quality and affordable parts and aftermarket accessories/kits.UPDATE: Updated it to Marlin 2.0.X bugfix branch just for thermal runaway

Brillant printer for its price.  But don't expect to start printing prints out of the box.  One needs to learn and explore.  It has its limitations which is understandable for the price.  But once it's strengths and weaknesses are kept in mind, it is a very capable printer.  Definitely recommended.  Don't expect too much support from the seller though.  I ran into trouble with the supplied bed sticker and ordered another one which failed in 2 prints.  That was because i was printing on ABS at 240 c for the extruder and 110 c bed temperature.  Once I switched to glass the prints are perfect.  Use normal float glass 4 mm with scotch purple glue and you are fine.

The printer has been a pain from day one. With no support whatsoever from the seller, the 3D printer has been a pain. Frequent parts failure, cheap quality of parts and need to buy spares are constant heartburn. Never was at peace after having bought it. The entry-level (relatively cheap) may be the cause of this being up on sale graph but its not at all recommended for people to want to pursue 3D printing as a serious hobby/career.

Reviewing after around a month of use and printing around 10 models.pros:The printer is good. The surface finish, print quality is good enough without any major upgrades/mods.Packaging was good, all the spares were in extra qty (seller probably repackaged and added that).all the tools required to assemble are provided in the package including allen-keys, spanner/wrenches, cutter, etcBed heating and magnetic bed really is a plus. Never had an issue for adhesion or removing the print from the bed till now.cons and tips:Received faulty limit switch attached to Z-axis. My printer wasn't "auto-homing" on z-axis, tried re-assembling, reconnecting wires, opening circuit board and testing connections but none of it solved the problem till I replaced the limit switch with the one spare provided in the package. (minus one star)(hope you send me a working limit switch module)They have specified black and white filament spools in the listing. But I received grey and fluorescent yellow spool of PLA.Allen-head bolts are of shitty quality. DO NOT put too much pressure on bolts with allen-heads to unscrew. The allen head will wear out very easily even if you are using the right allen keys and the you won't be able to screw-unscrew that part. (I had to break a metal piece of the enclosure of the "mother-board" and now, z-stepper allen-bolt is also weared out.) (minus one star)Z-axis assembly is toughest. Also the z-axis bar/linear rail rod comes closer and tighter as you go down. You would need to print this part first - z-axis spacer and assemble it on the printer to avoid rapid wear-out (stl available on thingiverse)Assembly is going to be tough. Do it carefully or else it won't print good. Watch good youtube tutorials before starting out. Know what you are doingBed leveling is important.Loosen out all the rollers and belt drives before assembling or it will damage the wheels. (they are too much tightened out of the box)Use ultimaker cura slicer instead of creality slicer, slicer software and settings largely affect the print quality.to conclude -This is my first 3D printer and despite of all the cons, when you see your model getting printed and see the output in your hands and fitting perfectly in your design assembly... it is the most satisfying feeling. So don't wait to buy one. I primarily use this printer to prototype my engineering designs for robotics and electronics assembly at my startup bitleaf.tech based in Dombivli, Maharashtra, India.

This is the best printer for the money we pay. But it lacks support in India.Installation and packing: The packing was nice, and I could install this within an hour. At some point, you may need to refer youtube for assembly.Build: The build quality is decent not that robust, but it will do the work. Make sure to check Bed alignment as it's always not the right alignment.Printing: Quality of prints comes very well. Mind that an average time to print for a 2"x2" would be around 2 hours.Board: It has The Creality 4.2.2 board with a boot loader.Support: Unfortunately, after 2 print, my printer went dead. I tried calling Amazon; they said it could only be refunded, and they had no support details from India.I sent a mail to Creality support but didn't get any reply from them. Their support phone number is from China.I fixed the issue by flashing the official firmware. You can download it from the Creality site and just past the .bin file on the SD card and plug it into the printer.I highly recommended flashing to new official firmware as the firmware which comes with the Printer is really old. I could see the difference in print quality and the more important printing speed; it improved slightly.

Printing and assembly is very easy and good quality. But the Laser head doesn't work as per the instructions (the software is also not complete installation version and it's in Chinese no other languages supported, just hit and trial). Company/seller provides no technical support for the Laser engraving attachment (that's just wastage of time and money).The sample filament provide with it also very poor quality, it break automatically after 2-3 days after unpacking.

I took a leap of faith with this Creality Ender 3 printer after reading reviews of WOL3D. Just followed the instructions provided in the sheet and watched few videos also on how to configure the printer. It isn't as difficult as it seems. Before I knew it, I did my first print.To my surprise, I did not encounter any problems like clogging, bed adhesion or missing parts in package. I even received a sample filament of few meters and an sd card with some gcode and design files in the package to print the first sample.

Have been using this printer for more than 4 months now. Multiple You Tube videos help setting up and fine tuning the slicer parameters. Have used PLA and ABS for the printing - the results are good.The moment you need any support from the seller (WOL 3D) you can forget it - calls lead you to autoresponders with a promise to get back to you which does not happen AT ALL, raising a ticket on their website goes into a black hole.Thinking of now getting support from third parties for repairs even though the machine is under warranty as it has developed a  snag which I believe has to do with the Electronics. At a critical juncture in the product design phase and can't afford downtime.Good product to buy but avoid WOL 3D as they just forget you once the product is dispatched from their facility.

Amazing product after 15 days of usage. I've heard lot of myth about 3d printers in general that has to be followed to get a good 3d print. However, this printer is dead simple and you cannot go wrong. The included filament and creality slicer is good enough to do all you want. All tools are included hence no need to have anything to set this up and running. Lot of information available in internet to upgrade this printer and I did most of them though they are just addons and not a must have and the default printer itself is enough. You really wont regret buying this model.

Packaged perfectly. Instructions were clear. Followed also some YouTube videos and assembled it in 2 hrs. The first print was perfect. I couldn't believe my eyes. Amazing printer. WOL3d doesn't actually do anything apart from branding the print surface and credit goes to Creality.Btw I got one with the new 32bit board(not silent). So firmware upgrade to Marlin was a breeze by just placing it in the SD card and booting.The frame must be checked for 90Â° angle at all places when assembling. Keep this in mind.Spend time to learn about bed levelling/tramming and also build surfaces. Also people should stop posting bad reviews without understanding the complexity of operating a 3d printer. Most negative reviews here are from people who haven't understood how to setup their printer.I did not need WOL3d for help so I don't know their support system. Anyways it's a Creality product and support is overflowingly available on the internet.

The ender 3 printer that I bought came with a bent aluminium bed. It is giving me a headache as I am not able to level.The display unit knob is broken. It skips input ( i.e sometimes turning the knob does not do anything). :(

I'm an Engineering student and i love making projects, prototyping etc. Ender 3 by Wol3D was my first 3D printer bought three months back. The printer arrived on time with every component inside enclosed with proper packaging. Only the spool holder nut was missing which i manage to print with this printer. The Assembly process was quite easy. I have been using it for various project and it has done well till date. No problem i faced, still this version has no auto bed levelling which could make beginner little annoying but hey practices makes perfect. Ender 3 is open source 3D printer with quite good resource for custom upgradation which you should do at your own risk, i am not willing to do it now cause at this factory setup its working great. If you wanna have a taste of 3D printing and doesn't have enough budget you can bet on it. Wol3D Seller is also very nice quite helpful, I'm from india their service is very good here. Ender 3 has great community in facebook. Their official group is quite helpful. So consider buying this one you can upgrade it in so many ways but again at your own risk, there are many youtube videos on this printer.

Working as expected.Dont know what are the things upgraded by WOL3D. Same as stock ender3 except orange rubber strips which are cumbersome to fit.Pl, check x axis horizontal, adjust eccentric roller, vertical aluminium sections are truly vertical after assembly for successfully first print .

Truly speaking itâ€™s an amazing printer with all features. The item arrived on time. Simply the best printer with at an affordable price. Guys do go for it if you want to enter into 3D printing for the first time
The print quality of Ender 3d is amazing for its priceing,,,, prompt delivery and excellent customer support by WOL 3D. Even you can disturb them on Sundays,,, very quick response from them.....

Order came in super quick time, exactly as promised by Amazon.2 days flat within Mumbai - 5 Stars!Product quality is sturdy and as described - 5 StarsPrint quality is excellent for the price - 5 starsInstructions - THIS could have been better, there is a sequence to follow but i think if they WRITE down what needs to get done, a novice like me would find it much easier. I had a technical person (a friend of mine) to support me, which made it much easier.  This is just something they can do better.I'm not taking away points for this because they provided excellent customer support (Ms Vinibha) in terms of answering my questions before I purchased off Amazon.So Overall 5 Stars. I will try out the product extensively and will add more info on it a month down the time.For now, Overall, i believe they (WOL3D) deserve 5 stars!

Bought this 3D printer to print model prototypes. Was wary initially about ease of assembling and operation. However, it worked like a charm. Followed Youtube instructions for ENDER 3D PRO assembly. Please make sure to level the bed and also the cut the filament end before feeding into the printer. The initial issues I had was due to these 2 issues.

It was partially assembled.took me 3 hours to make it work by following the instructions given with it.Print quality are amazing. after getting this printed so many things and so many printer parts itself.Easy to use and buy it if you are techie and love to do this kind of work.Can say this is the best printer available in market at this price. Just go for it.

The seller has very bad after sales service. Just after 20 days of using the bed is wobbly and not able to fix the alignment whatsoever. I have been requesting them for personal visit even paid is fine, but the technician and support team just do not care. I would suggest buy from some other vendor with better after sales service. Also the feeder plastic part is broken just in 20 days.

This is my first 3d printer and I ordered it just to experient with it. I saw a lot of YouTube videos and various forums and finally decided to order this product. Apart from the Ender 3 that is already known, there is nothing else. The package was delivered carefully and on time. Instead of using the assembly guide that came with the printer, I watched a YouTube video to assemble this and it took about an hour and half. And after some bed leveling, the printer was ready to print. The print quality is excellent and the box contains everything you need to get started with 3d printing. Just remember to order a spool of filament along with the printer as the sample provided with the printer is very small. Also, one thing with my print bed, it has a little bump about 0.1mm at the centre and the first layer won't print there and also sometimes it's really hard to remove the prints and therefore I am planning to order a glass bed. Apart from that, the printer is perfect to get started with 3d printing. If you are starting out with 3d printing, just go for it.
For integrating laser engraver wol3d won't give support..... Please don't but the combo...

Better use octoprint with pi because this is like a dumbed-down version of a router with very very limited and controlled features.Only can work from phones ( not pcs), cloud slicing kinda whack, and there is much difficulties operating the thing.Not recommended.

It is my first printer got in 17 thousand . Assembling was very difficult for me but YouTube helped. I have printed many things , n it's great fun also useful for engineering student n even normal person can print n enjoy to learn or make toys . I am now printing covid mask .

I bought it before Covid-19 lockdown @ Rs 15,500.... it is working good...... all the accessory for printing is in there [like:- sd card,sdcard reader,nipper,etc].... ii am very much happy with it....

No instructions provided on how to connect the laser engraver. No response from WOL 3D regarding the same query posted on there web site. Can anybody please provide me with the details of how the laser engraver is to be connected

Getting a print from this machine - you have to be LUCKY.my 3 year old CR-10 prints like a boss yet.Ender-3. A BIG DISAAPPOINTMENT.Extruder clicking - no extrusion, thin extrusion lines. the bed doesnt move fully on the Y axis without a cable crunching sound.

Appears that I received a refurbished model as the build plate had been scratched and did not stay level . Also just after I buy the price dropped and different ones came. So I returned mine and buying a different model

10 stars for the product items..As they provided each and every tool.Even an amount of filament for print purpose, all hardware tools, card reader memory card, even 2set of nozzles,Its a great and.. very easy to assemble.Have very nice accuracy..A huge shoutout to the company for great buying experience..

Product was good at this price range,leveling bed is a bit tricky part , I assembled it with instructions paper provided it's that simple to assemble, purchase an adaptor for the power cable which costs around hundred rupees,tried with white PLA,have to do some test on flexible material,works fine for me

Pros- Print quality is amazing...particularly photo prints.- support for higher GSM and wide variety of papers, even PVC cards- Much better than previous generations..  - LCD display  - ink bottle system  - self serviceable parts  - Airprint supportCons- Setup is not user friendly- About Canon print/scan software, less said the better.- Little noisy

WiFi printing is awesome. The print quality is very good. Installation is simple. Ink management using external tanks is a very good feature, you won't have to buy the entire printing head cartridges. My opinion, buy it if it fits your budget.

This is a great color printer for home or personal (infrequent) use. The following review is accordingly with that in mind. If you are a heavy user, then you should ideally be looking to buy a good quality laser printer instead of an inkjet printer.I have been using this printer for a few months now and am very happy with my purchase. Thecolor prints are fantastic - much better than the neighborhood photo studio (make sure you use good quality print paper - I use Kodak glossy print sheets). Also the canon print utility allows you to easily print borderless photos. Black and white prints are satisfactory as well. One thing to note is that by default the print settings are at Standard quality. Unless you are printing drafts, I would advise setting it to High.The scanner could have been better. It isn't great but its passable. Make sure you update the scan dpi settings to highest available (600 dpi) else you will get pixellated scans. Ideally I would have liked the option of 1200 dpi scans.The other good to have would have been automatic duplex - it only has manual duplex mode.The printer comes with 1 black and 3 color ink cartridges - and the inktank windows allow you to see exactly how much ink is remaining. I don't know how many prints the inks would give in total since I use the printer occassionally so still to run out of the first ink fill - but as I've said earlier, if you're a heavy user then a laser printer is the way to go. If you are an occassional user and need good quality color prints, then this printer is highly recommended. Even though its a bit expensive, the color photographs are superb.

I was looking for a moderately priced ink-tank printer which could  offer multiple functions of  print-scan-copy in a wireless mode and support web based and smart phone printing options. I found all these in HP Ink Tank Wireless 410 printer.Got it today.  My observations:Pros:a. Excellent packingb. Crisp instructions to installc. Smooth installation process (including wireless set up)d. Smooth printing (direct, web, via email, smartphone)e. smudge and spill free ink fillingf. User removable print headg. Duplex printing (manual change over)h. Booklet printing that is easy to manageCons:a. Paper tray has limited capacityb. You have to be savvy to learn the functioning of Control Panel of the printer (you will need to download manuals from the web)c. Though the printer comes with installation CD, they encourage you to download the software from the web.d. Paper out area has a big opening and is likely to have dust accumulatione. No easy way to do a quick scan (wish they had a shortcut for it)f. allows paper thickness of upto 90 gsm only (desirable was at least 100)g. it makes you dump lot of polythene and plastic as a part of installation. Even the print head area has a full packing which one feels bad discarding.In short, be ready to spend some time to familiarise yourself with the printer.Despite the cons, it is good value for money. Best in its class, I would feel.

I bought this one for my home office. The first impression was good and printing was fine. After the first use, I didn't used the printer for a week. When I tried to print again, the printer didn't print at all, I got a blank sheet. When I searched a lot on the internet; I found that, this is a common issue. If you won't use the printer on a regular basis, the ink forms clotting on the print heads and you can't use it anymore without servicing the heads. I did a servicing and after that, each alternative day I printed something to keep the printer alive. After 5 months of use the printer stopped working, it is not detecting the print head anymore. When I tried to find a service centre there is literally 'none' nearby my place (There is only 1 service centre in the whole area which is 50KM away from my place).The issues I've faced so far:1) Ink clots on printhead if you won't use it on a regular basis2) There is no service centres nearby3) Ink to print head everything is very costly4) The ink level indicator never worked in my case5) The software/printing apps are really badI won't recommend this product to anybody, it's a money pit. You will lose a lot of money to just maintain this printer. I regret buying this one. Good bye to HP & it's products.

I took a risk and bought this printer, as I'm using Linux mint on my computer...nothing was mentioned about it working on Linux. Before I got it, I had a tough time as to what should I do if it doesn't work on Linux, finally I bought it as it also has wireless connectivity...I'm happy to report this:The pros:Wireless, so u can print straight from the smartphone,Also can print thru a router, easy to set up.Usb printing for windows and Mac.I had trouble with Linux usb, but after going to the hplip download website, managed to get everything working.. very good printing, cheap and effective for home printing..Value for money, as cartridges last long.Scanner works well, so xeroxing is easy, even coloured .Setting up is easy once u read everything correctly..Paper is top loading, so even thick paper will work for cards n stuff.No adaptor, straight power cord connection, India plug.Ink levels can easily be seen.Ink refills come with the printer. 1 black and 3 coloured (CMYK).All settings can beThe cons:No support drivers for Linux on the cd., Only windows and Mac.Power button difficult to make out, as it isn't printed with white ink. Can only make out after led lights up.

I have bought this product recently. Everything was ok, until I tumble with the problem of configuring the printer with D link DIR -816 wifi router.  Had to raise a HP service request to make a visit technical engineer to investigate the issue and fix it.  After hearing the issue the HP technical engineer informed us that HP printer don't support D link DIR-816 router. And also, informed there are many router which HP Printer don't support. There is workaround but that's not a full proof & fully functions.After googling found that same issue is faced by many customers. HP Printer don't support all router.I would request Amazon & the OEM that please ensure you publish all the list of Router to all customer which are NOT supported by HP ink tank wireless printer. This will help to avoid harassment & bed review for HP product.Customer who are reading this review, please ensure that your home wifi router supports HP Printer.

This printer is ok for the price. Easy to set up. Appears durable (just got it today) and has a nice form factor. Yet to try the wireless printing capabilities.The print time (color) for basic documents without too many graphics is ok and not too slow. The scanner however is a major let down. Disappointing color rendering and scanned image quality (sub par resolution). Scanning is sloooow!Buy this printer only if you don't have to do much document / image scanning and if you are only looking for printing documents.I haven't yet printed any photographs. Will add to this review once I try thst out.Update: It is now a year (October 2019) since I bought this printer. Just printed some 300 pages over the year! The tri-color printhead stopped working. HP support replaced the printhead (onsite service) within 24 hours! Very impressive service. WiFi connected, works like a charm and the best is no cords! Not happy with the photo printing though.

So i got this printer for a good bargain about a month back. Here is what I like about it -1. Very easy to setup; Just follow the guides step by step and you cannot go wrong. Connected to wifi very easily as well. The overall setup took about 45 minutes but, then i was slow and reading each step carefully.2. Offers a web based console that keeps a complete check on the printer's activities, how many pages it has printed and so on; Very useful.3. Print quality - Good as it can be. Haven't printed any photos. Documents have been crisp.4. Supports Apple's wifi protocol; Can allow you to print from any devices without any hassles.5. Supports wifi scanFew things that I feel, i didn't like.1. Printed paper collection tray; Its very delicate. I feel if any pressure is put, it will break down.2. Supports only manual back to back printing (its in the specs); Now if you try to turn the sheet and try to feed it, few times it slips thru a minor gap between printer and feeder.Overall impressions - after using it for nearly a month, i am happy and can't really complain. I hope now the ink tank does stand it promise and give me an ability to print about 3000 odd papers. that will be 1 ink tank fill for a year.

One has to manually reverse each sheet to get print on the other sidePros--10paise per print-wireless, print directly from phone-free installation by professionals-cheaper than market price at amazon-very high quality scan and print-photocopy function is also resonably good-very easy to useVerdict- go for it!

I faced a host of issues with setup:It arrived fast, but there are problems with technical support and the seller.1. Seller has started the warranty before sale. My printer had the warranty period started 1 month before I even purchased the product when I checked online. Please type HP warranty check and make sure you don't have this issue! If you do, call HP support, show them the invoice and payslip with serial number and urgently update the mismatch. It will take 24-48 hours.2. When I tried to set up the printer, I ran into some issues with the wifi setup, and trust me it takes a tech savvy person at least 45 minutes to figure out how to proceed. So then I wanted to request a HP installation engineer (which every customer with a new product is entitled to).3. The seller has *already* used my printer's unique serial number to register an engineer installation for someone else some time before selling me the product. I cannot have a free HP engineer come to my house now as they only do it once and HP asked me to contact the amazon seller directly. So if you need an engineer's help, then good luck. You will have to call HP technical support and do everything yourself like I did.4. A 'Start Here' blue booklet/guide is missing in the box and a setup CD. This made figuring out how to setup 2x harder and I had to look up the HP manuals online.5. Wifi setup isn't smooth, even when I installed everything correctly and followed instructions. I had to open my TP link router management webpage and set up the WPS link through that - or else the wifi will keep disconnecting from the printer.6. I set up the Google Assistant Voice activation. Just download the google assistant app and say 'speak to HP printer' and it will add a new printer.  Color print is ok. 1200 dpi scan will be a bit slow, lower resolutions much faster. The same with printing.7. The seller responded to my question about the warranty and engineer request by saying 'if product is under warranty please contact HP' after selling it to me less than 3 days ago! I may return it and buy directly from HP.8. The printer itself is good, for initial setup check youtube or type hp 410 manuals on google and set up with that. Not too complex - fill the ink, insert the printerheads and run an alignment. Download the HP smart app.Bottom line, buy directly from HP for peace of mind regarding warranty and ease of installation, or try another seller. I may return it as an exchange period of 7 days is available, but I don't want to end up with the same seller again.

It's been more than a year since I purchased this one. Printed quality was great initially during first few pages/photos, for a month.Then lines started appearing, requiring very frequent troubleshooting through hp smart app. After 4-5 months usage, black printhead stopped printing. Online and on telephone support didn't help, so finally customer care guy came and after checking, replaced the black print head, under warranty.Then after a year and 1 month exactly, after a total print count of less than 150 pages, the color cartridge stopped being detected. And then, it doesn't print anything, simply freezes at power on asking to check cartridge (print head), though black printhead is detected perfectly.Now no warranty, so customer care asked me to purchase the printhead. When I asked that it's printed less than150 pages so far, how can print-heads are getting spoilt so soon. The epic explanation: "printhead delivered as part of new printer aren't of that good quality, you need to buy new one"..Another problem, even if one printhead is faulty, and replaceable as a single piece, you need to buy both (black & color) as a set because HP doesn't sell them individually. And you've got no option, it's monopoly as usual, once you've purchased the printer.This printer looks good and wifi works perfectly, but that's not what I paid money for. Print quality is good only when it's new, and then it turns frustrating. Paper fetching also doesn't work smoothly, I many times need to keep shaking the paper in tray before it finally detects.I've got a far cheaper black ink laser printer from another company working perfectly for last 11 years. This one has given me enough headaches in one year itself.And as the ink-tanks are not getting empty faster, looks like hp has decided to compensate by selling more printheads. I don't know how often I'll need to order them.I wouldn't buy any printer from hp in future for sure.

The printer turns out to be one of the worst purhase decisions we made.It worked fine for 2 months in the beginning but the condition is really bad after that.1.It gives error 2/3/4 which are only described in online video platforms as non debuggable errors.Once you get that error you as a user cannot solve the issue yourself.Saw various videos which said a paper should be stuck but there was none. Checked using torches and various methods mentioned on online video platforms. It kills your time and gives you no output.The only option you have is to wait for 3-4 days after which the printer decides that it can now print again.2. Color Printout on glossy sheets is smudgy.When you buy a Rs12,000 color printer you would want to take out some photos on a glossy sheet.The printer let's you do that but you cannot touch the printed part of the paper for ever. IF you do it leaves a black residue and smudges the whole photograph. The printout is simply untouchable for ever.3. Printer stops during Printing.Sometimes the printer stops midway during printing. You just wait and cajole the printer to throw out the sheet but it won't. It holds on to the sheet even though it has printed it and you cannot use your print.4. Device does not allow Wifi printingWe have an airtel wifi in the house for 5 years now. Quite consistent in speed and performance.The HP printer allows wifi printing on certain days from the mobile and on other days you need to switch on the laptop to print using wifi.The mobile wi-fi printing the main reason we purchased the printer simply does not work.5. HP Smart App.The HP smart app does not show any error or problem even when the printer shows Error3/4. It keeps showing the printer is Ready.We keep sending the prints but nothing get's printed.6. Poor Customer Service.a. The customer service number is not reachable from Airtel phones. It gets disconnected within 1 second of dialing the call.b. From prepaid vodafone numbers it says the call is chargeable and disconnects the call.7. The printer has already broken down twice in the 3 months that we have owned it. Ticket logging with HP is a headache. You are asked to explain and try everything on your own from fiddling with the printer when it is on to taking out the printer heads and replacing them back when the printer is still on. At the end of a 30-40 minute conversation they log your ticket and assign an engineer a day later. the engineer further takes between 3-4 days to come and set the printer right.Both the times parts had to be changed and that is what we were trying to explain to the Customer Rep but they make it sound as your mistake.(Paper would be stuck, not enough ink, paper gsm quality, paper company, type etc)Alas the poor quaity problem remains the same. If you buy a home printer you are likely to suffer for having paid these companies.
